features.name: <a>
features.description: The <a> element creates a hyperlink to any resource that's accessible via a URL, such as web pages, files, email addresses, or locations within the same page.

features.name: <abbr>
features.description: The <abbr> HTML element represents an abbreviation or acronym.

features.name: Abortable fetch
features.description: If you construct a fetch request with an AbortSignal, you can cancel the request.

features.name: AbortController and AbortSignal
features.description: The AbortController and AbortSignal APIs allow you to cancel an ongoing operation, such as a fetch() request.

features.name: AbortSignal.any()
features.description: The AbortSignal.any() static method combines an iterable of abort signals into a single signal, with the abort reason taken from the first signal to abort.

features.name: abs() and sign()
features.description: The abs() and sign() CSS functions compute the absolute value or the sign of the input.

features.name: Absolute positioning
features.description: The position: absolute CSS declaration removes an element from the normal flow and positions it relative to its containing block, which is often the root element, or closest positioned ancestor.

features.name: Accelerometer
features.description: The Accelerometer, LinearAccelerationSensor and GravitySensor APIs read the acceleration applied to a device in three dimensions, either including the effect of gravity, without its effect, or only its effect, respectively.

safari_desktop.notes: Vendor position : oppose (concerns: duplication, privacy, venue, use cases, power, device independence)

safari_ios.notes: Vendor position : oppose (concerns: duplication, privacy, venue, use cases, power, device independence)

features.name: accent-color
features.description: The accent-color CSS property sets a color for checkboxes, radio buttons, and other form controls.

features.name: accesskey
features.description: The accesskey global HTML attribute gives a hint for generating a keyboard shortcut for the current element. The attribute value must consist of a single printable character.

features.name: Accessor methods
features.description: The __defineGetter__() and __defineSetter__() methods of objects bind a function to a property, which is called on setting or reading the property.

features.name: Active view transition
features.description: The :active-view-transition CSS pseudo-class matches the root element when a view transition is active. The :active-view-transition-type() CSS pseudo-class matches only when the active view transition was started with the specified type. Baseline availability blocked since December 2024 by Firefox (7 months)

features.name: <address>
features.description: The <address> element represents contact information for a person or people, or for an organization.

features.name: Alerts
features.description: The window.alert(), window.confirm(), and window.prompt() methods open modal dialogs for notifying the user, asking for confirmation, or entering text.

features.name: align-content in block layouts
features.description: The align-content property vertically aligns content in block layouts, like it does in flex or grid layouts.

features.name: alignment-baseline
features.description: The alignment-baseline CSS property sets which baseline of an element is aligned with the corresponding baseline of its parent. Baseline availability blocked since January 2020 by Firefox (66 months)

features.name: all
features.description: The all CSS property is a shorthand for all CSS properties, except for direction and unicode-bidi. It accepts only the keywords for explicit defaulting (such as initial and inherit), since they are the only values supported on all CSS properties.

features.name: Alt text for generated content
features.description: The / notation in content CSS property values adds alternative text to generated content. For example, the content: url('upvote-icon.svg') / 'Upvote' declaration adds accessible 'Upvote' text to the SVG icon. Also known as alternate text.

features.name: Alternative style sheets
features.description: The rel="alternate stylesheet" attribute for the <link> HTML element offers an alternative style option to users.

features.name: Ambient light sensor
features.description: The AmbientLightSensor interface returns the current light level in lux of the ambient light level around the device.

features.name: Anchor positioning
features.description: Anchor positioning places an element based on the position of another element. For example, you can place a tooltip next to the content it references.

features.name: ANGLE_instanced_arrays WebGL extension
features.description: The ANGLE_instanced_arrays extension for WebGL 1.0 contexts draws the same object multiple times or groups of similar objects multiple times, if the group shares the same vertex data, primitive count and type.

features.name: animation-composition
features.description: The animation-composition CSS property chooses how to combine animations that affect the same property.

features.name: Animations (CSS)
features.description: The animation CSS property animates an element's style over time, using keyframes described in @keyframes rules.

features.name: File handlers
features.description: The file_handlers web app manifest member registers an installed web app as a handler for files with specific file extensions or MIME types.

features.name: Launch handler
features.description: The launch_handler web app manifest member, with the client_mode property, configure how web app launches behave when an instance of the app is already open. For example, you can choose to focus the existing app instance instead of launching a new one.

features.name: Protocol handlers
features.description: The protocol_handlers web app manifest member registers an installed web app as a handler for a specific protocol. When a user follows a link with the specified protocol, the installed app opens the link.

features.name: Share targets
features.description: The share_target web app manifest member registers an installed web app as a handler for shared content. When a user shares content by using the device share dialog, the installed app can be listed as an option for handling the shared content.

features.name: Application shortcuts
features.description: The shortcuts web app manifest member registers common actions of an installed web app with the device. The device can present these actions to the user in contextually appropriate locations, such as jump lists on Windows or the app launcher on Android.

features.name: appearance
features.description: The appearance CSS property controls the appearance of form controls. Using appearance: none disables any default native appearance and allows the elements to be styled with CSS.

features.name: arguments.callee
features.description: The callee property of the arguments variable in a non-strict function body's local scope is the function that arguments belongs to.

features.name: ARIA attribute reflection
features.description: WAI-ARIA attributes have corresponding properties on Element and ElementInternals objects.

features.name: Array (initial support)
features.description: Arrays are ordered lists of JavaScript values.

features.name: Array at()
features.description: The at() method of arrays and typed arrays returns the item at an index, including negative indices for getting items relative to the end of an array. Also known as the relative indexing method.

features.name: Array by copy
features.description: The toReversed(), toSorted(), toSpliced(), and with() methods of arrays and typed arrays return changed copies of arrays. They stand in contrast to methods such as sort() or reverse() that change arrays in place.

features.name: Array copyWithin()
features.description: The copyWithin() method of arrays and typed arrays shifts or copies items of an array to another index of the array without changing its length.

features.name: Array fill()
features.description: The fill() method of arrays and typed arrays sets all or some items of an array to a given a value.

features.name: Array find() and findIndex()
features.description: The find() and findIndex() methods of arrays and typed arrays search an array for the first item that satisfies a test function.

features.name: Array findLast() and findLastIndex()
features.description: The findLast() and findLastIndex() methods of arrays and typed arrays search an array in reverse order for the first item that satisfies a test function.

features.name: Array flat() and flatMap()
features.description: The flat() and flatMap() methods for arrays creates a new array such that each nested array item is concatenated into it.

features.name: Array.from()
features.description: The Array.from() and typed array .from() static methods copy items from an iterable or array-like object to make a new array.

features.name: Array.fromAsync()
features.description: The Array.fromAsync() static method copies items from an async iterable object to make a new array.

features.name: Array grouping
features.description: The Object.groupBy() and Map.groupBy() static methods group values of arrays and iterables based on a function that returns a key for each value.

features.name: Array includes()
features.description: The includes() method of arrays and typed arrays returns whether a given value appears in the array.

features.name: Array.isArray()
features.description: The Array.isArray() static method checks whether a value is an array.

features.name: Array iteration methods
features.description: Array iteration methods

features.name: Array iterators
features.description: Arrays are iterable with the for â€¦ of statement and enumerable with the methods entries(), keys(), and values().

features.name: Array.of()
features.description: The Array.of() and typed array .of() static methods create new arrays from the values of any number of arguments.

features.name: Array splice()
features.description: The array splice() method changes an array in-place. You can use it to delete items, overwrite items, or insert items, starting from an index.

features.name: <article>
features.description: The <article> element represents self-contained content, which is intended to be independently distributable or reusable, such as a comment, a blog post, or news article.

features.name: <aside>
features.description: The <aside> element represents a portion of a document whose content is only indirectly related to the document's main content.

features.name: aspect-ratio
features.description: The aspect-ratio CSS property controls the width-to-height ratio of elements. For and

features.name: Async functions
features.description: The async and await keywords allow you to use the asynchronous, promise-based behavior of a function without using promise chains.

features.name: Async clipboard
features.description: The navigator.clipboard API asynchronously reads and writes to the system clipboard.

features.name: Async generators
features.description: Async generator functions (async function*) create iterators that return multiple promises, one after another, on-demand.

features.name: Asynchronously iterable streams
features.description: Asynchronous iteration of a stream allows you to use for await â€¦ of loops to iterate through a stream's incoming data. Baseline availability blocked since April 2024 by Safari (15 months)

features.name: Async iterators and the for await..of loop
features.description: Asynchronous iterator objects, such as those returned by promises or generator functions, are iterable with the for await .. of loop.

features.name: Atomics.pause()
features.description: The Atomics.pause() static method gives a hint to the CPU that the code calling the method is in a short-duration wait for shared memory, known as spinning or a spinlock.

features.name: Atomics.waitAsync
features.description: The Atomics.waitAsync() static method waits for a value in a shared memory location, providing a promise when the expected value is not yet in memory. The waitAsync() method is a non-blocking alternative to Atomics.wait(). Baseline availability blocked since March 2023 by Firefox (28 months)

features.name: attr()
features.description: The attr() CSS function, in the context of any property, returns the value of an attribute of an HTML element, with the option to return it as a specific type or unit. You can set a default value for missing or invalid attributes.

features.name: attr() (content only)
features.description: The attr() CSS function, in content property declarations, sets a ::before or ::after pseudo-element's content to the value of the specified HTML attribute.

features.name: Attribution reporting
features.description: The Attribution Reporting API measures when an ad click or view leads to a conversion, such as a purchase on an advertiser site.

features.name: <audio>
features.description: The <audio> element plays sound such as audio effects or music, optionally with controls provided by the browser.

features.name: Audio session
features.description: The navigator.audioSession API controls how audio playback interacts with other applications. For example, playing music can pause audio from other applications, while ambient audio can play at the same time.

features.name: Audio and video tracks
features.description: The audioTracks and videoTracks APIs for media elements switch audio and video tracks during playback.

features.name: AudioWorklet
features.description: The AudioWorklet API runs module code in a separate thread, specifically for non-blocking, low latency audio processing.

features.name: autocapitalize
features.description: The autocapitalize global HTML attribute sets the virtual keyboard capitalization behavior for user input on an element, such as the first letter of sentences or all words. Baseline availability blocked since March 2023 by Safari (28 months)

features.name: autocorrect
features.description: The autocorrect global HTML attribute controls whether to automatically correct spelling or punctuation errors for user input.

features.name: autofocus
features.description: The autofocus HTML attribute gives focus to an element on page load.

features.name: Autonomous custom elements
features.description: Autonomous custom elements are HTML elements with a hyphenated tag name (like <example-element>) that have behaviors you define.

features.name: AVIF
features.description: AVIF (AV1 Image File Format) is an image format based on the AV1 video format.

features.name: <b>
features.description: The <b> HTML element draws reader's attention to text, styling text as bold by default.

features.name: backdrop-filter
features.description: The backdrop-filter CSS property applies graphical effects such as blurring or color shifting to the area behind an element.

features.name: background
features.description: The background CSS property is a shorthand that sets several background properties at once.

features.name: background-attachment
features.description: The background-attachment CSS property sets whether an element's background image or gradient moves as the element scrolls.

features.name: background-blend-mode
features.description: The background-blend-mode CSS property blends an element's background image and background color using blend modes like multiply, difference, or color.

features.name: background-clip
features.description: The background-clip CSS property sets the extent of the background: the padding box, the content box, or the default border box.

features.name: background-clip: border-area
features.description: The background-clip: border-area CSS declaration draws the background underneath only the border of an element.

features.name: background-clip: text
features.description: The background-clip: text CSS declaration draws the background underneath only the text in the element. Baseline availability blocked since December 2023 by Firefox (19 months)

features.name: background-color
features.description: The background-color CSS property sets the fill color of an element, behind any content and background images or gradients.

features.name: Background fetch
features.description: Background fetch downloads data in the background even when the web page is closed.

features.name: background-image
features.description: The background-image CSS property sets the graphics to display behind the content of an element and in front of the background color. Graphics may be any combination of images or gradients.

features.name: background-origin
features.description: The background-origin CSS property sets the background starting position relative to the border and padding of an element.

features.name: background-position
features.description: The background-position CSS property offsets the initial position of background images relative to the background origin.

features.name: background-repeat
features.description: The background-repeat CSS property sets how a background image is tiled.

features.name: background-size
features.description: The background-size CSS property scales or stretches a background based on the size of the element (with the contain and cover keywords), a length, or percentage.

features.name: Background sync
features.description: The background synchronization API registers a service worker callback to run only when the device is no longer offline. You can use this to let users continue using your app while offline and synchronize with a server after reconnecting.

features.name: Badging
features.description: The navigator.setAppBadge() method allows installed web applications to display an application badge, typically a dot or number shown alongside the application's icon on the device's home screen or application dock.

features.name: Barcode detector
features.description: The BarcodeDetector API recognizes various barcode formats in images.

features.name: BarProp
features.description: The visible property of the window.locationbar, window.menubar, window.personalbar, window.scrollbars, window.statusbar, and window.toolbar APIs historically represented the visibility of a browser user interface. For privacy reasons, it now represents whether the window is a pop-up.

features.name: <base>
features.description: The <base> element sets the base URL (the URL that relative URLs are relative to) for all relative URLs in the document.

features.name: Base64 encoding and decoding
features.description: The atob() and btoa() global functions encode and decode strings to and from base 64, respectively.

features.name: baseline-shift
features.description: The baseline-shift CSS property sets the position of an element relative to its dominant baseline. Baseline availability blocked since January 2020 by Firefox (66 months)

features.name: baseline-source
features.description: The baseline-source CSS property controls how inline-level boxes with multiple lines of text are aligned with the surrounding text. By default, which typographic baseline is used depends on the display property value. Baseline availability blocked since July 2023 by Safari (24 months)

features.name: Battery status
features.description: The navigator.getBattery() API obtains information about the device's battery, including charge level and status. Also known as the Battery API.

features.name: <bdi>
features.description: The <bdi> element isolates text that may have a different text direction from its surrounding text. This prevents the browser's bidirectional text algorithm from affecting or being affected by the direction of the surrounding text.

features.name: <bdo>
features.description: The <bdo> element overrides the directionality of text, so that the text within is rendered in a different direction than the surrounding text.

features.name: Beacons
features.description: The navigator.sendBeacon() method asynchronously sends an HTTP POST request with a limited amount of data, typically for app state, events, and analytics data. The one-way beacon is guaranteed to be initiated before the browser unloads the page, but the sender does not get to handle the response.

features.name: beforeinstallprompt
features.description: The beforeinstallprompt event fires when a Progressive Web App (PWA) is installable, usually on page load in browsers that support installing PWAs. You can use this event to prevent the install prompt from appearing until after the user interacts with an element on the page.

features.name: beforeunload
features.description: The beforeunload event is fired when the current window is about to be unloaded. Typically this is used to display a dialog to confirm if users really want to leave the page when there is unsaved data that would be lost. Baseline availability blocked since July 2015 by Safari on iOS (120 months)

features.name: Back/forward cache blocking reasons
features.description: The notRestoredReasons property of a PerformanceNavigationTiming object explains why the current document was blocked from using the back/forward cache (also known as the bfcache) on navigation.

features.name: BigInt
features.description: The BigInt JavaScript type represents integers of any size, including integers too large for the primitive Number type.

features.name: BigInt64Array
features.description: The BigInt64Array and BigUint64Array typed arrays represent 64-bit integers, signed and unsigned respectively.

features.name: blocking="render"
features.description: The blocking="render" attribute for <link>, <script>, and <style> elements blocks rendering until the external script or stylesheet has been loaded. For <link rel="expect">, rendering is blocked until a specific element is in the DOM. Baseline availability blocked since December 2024 by Firefox (7 months)

features.name: <blockquote>
features.description: The <blockquote> element represents an extended quotation, styling contents as an indented block by default.

features.name: <body>
features.description: The <body> element represents the content of an HTML document.

features.name: Border images
features.description: The border-image CSS property draws an image around an element.

features.name: border-radius
features.description: The border-radius CSS property rounds the corners of the border drawn around an element.

features.name: Borders
features.description: The border CSS property sets the color, style, and width of the line around an element.

features.name: box-decoration-break
features.description: The box-decoration-break CSS property sets whether box decorations, such as borders or backgrounds, of an element divided across a page, column, or region wraps each fragment or splits across the break. Baseline availability blocked since October 2024 by Safari (9 months)

features.name: box-shadow
features.description: The box-shadow CSS property applies shadow effects around an element's frame. This can create drop shadow and inner shadow effects.

features.name: box-sizing
features.description: The box-sizing CSS property sets whether an element's width and height are calculated based on the content-box, which does not count the size of borders or padding, or border-box, which does count them.

The
element produces line breaks in text.

features.name: BroadcastChannel
features.description: The BroadcastChannel API allows you to send messages between same-origin browsing contexts, such as between the same page loaded in multiple tabs.

features.name: Brotli compression
features.description: Brotli is a lossless data compression algorithm. When used as a content encoding, it often provides better compression than gzip.

features.name: <button>
features.description: The <button> HTML element represents a button that triggers some action, such as submitting a form or opening a dialog, styled as a labeled rectangular box by default.

features.name: calc()
features.description: The calc() CSS function computes mathematical expressions such a calc(100%/3 - 1em).

features.name: calc() keywords
features.description: The e, pi, infinity, and NaN keywords represent well-defined constants accepted in CSS math functions such as calc().

features.name: calc-size()
features.description: The calc-size() CSS function computes mathematical expressions that include height and width keyword values, for example calc-size(fit-content, size / 2). Not to be confused with the calc() CSS function, which cannot use keyword values.

features.name: <canvas>
features.description: The <canvas> HTML element is a space to draw graphics in, using the 2D canvas API, WebGL, or WebGPU.

features.name: Color management for 2D canvas
features.description: The optional colorSpace parameter of a 2D canvas's getContext() method chooses the color representation, such as "srgb" or "display-p3". Baseline availability blocked since December 2021 by Firefox (43 months)

features.name: Desynchronized 2D canvas
features.description: The optional desynchronized parameter of a canvas's getContext() method permits the browser to draw a 2D canvas independently of the event loop. This can reduce drawing latency. Baseline availability blocked since September 2021 by Firefox (46 months)

features.name: willReadFrequently
features.description: The optional willReadFrequently parameter of a canvas's getContext() method permits the browser to optimize for frequent getImageData() calls by avoiding hardware acceleration. Also known as multiple readback.

features.name: contextlost and contextrestored
features.description: The contextlost event for <canvas> fires when the canvas backing storage is lost, while the contextrestored event fires when it is recreated. Baseline availability blocked since April 2024 by Safari (15 months)

features.name: Canvas createConicGradient()
features.description: The createConicGradient() methods draw a conic gradient to a 2D canvas.

features.name: Canvas reset()
features.description: The reset() method clears a canvas to its initial state.

features.name: Canvas roundRect()
features.description: The roundRect() methods draw a rounded rectangle to a 2D canvas.

features.name: cap unit
features.description: The cap CSS length unit corresponds to the height of Latin capital letters.

features.name: captureStream() for <audio> and <video>
features.description: The captureStream() method for <audio> and <video> elements returns a MediaStream for the media element's content. You can use this to record media or send it elsewhere, such as a canvas or WebRTC connection.

features.name: captureStream() for <canvas>
features.description: The captureStream() method for <canvas> elements returns a MediaStream which includes a CanvasCaptureMediaStreamTrack representing real-time video of the canvas image. You can use this to record the canvas, or send it elsewhere, such as another canvas or WebRTC connection.

features.name: caret-color
features.description: The caret-color CSS property sets the color of the text insertion pointer in a text input.

features.name: Cascade layers
features.description: The @layer CSS at-rule avoids specificity conflicts by providing priority levels for different groups of CSS rules, such as low-priority styles like resets, and high-priority styles like UI components.

features.name: Case-insensitive attribute selector
features.description: The i identifier in a CSS attribute selector matches attribute values case-insensitively in document languages like XML where attribute values are case-sensitive.

features.name: Case-sensitive attribute selector
features.description: The s identifier in a CSS attribute selector matches attribute values case-sensitively in document languages like HTML where attribute values are case-insensitive.

features.name: ch unit
features.description: The ch CSS length unit is a font-relative length based on the width of the zero (0) character.

features.name: Change event
features.description: The change event for <input>, <select>, and <textarea> elements fires when the user modifies the element's value. Unlike the input event, the change event does not necessarily fire on every alteration to an element's value.

features.name: Channel messaging
features.description: Channel messaging communicates one-to-one between browsing contexts on the same origin, such as between <iframe> elements or two documents using a shared worker.

features.name: checkVisibility()
features.description: The checkVisibility() method checks if an element is potentially visible, with optional parameters for the kinds of visibility to check. For example, it checks whether the element has the style display: none, but can also check for visibility: hidden.

features.name: <cite>
features.description: The <cite> element represents the title of a quoted, referenced, or mentioned creative work, such as a film or book.

features.name: Classes
features.description: Classes are an object-oriented syntax for JavaScript prototypes.

features.name: Clearing site data
features.description: The Clear-Site-Data header deletes browsing data (such as cookies, storage, or cache) associated with the requesting website.

features.name: clip
features.description: The clip CSS property sets the visible area of an absolutely positioned element.

features.name: clip-path
features.description: The clip-path CSS property and SVG attribute set the visible area of an element. Everything outside the area will be hidden.

features.name: Animatable clipping paths
features.description: The clip-path property can be animated using CSS transitions and animations.

features.name: Clip path boxes
features.description: The fill-box, stroke-box, and view-box values for clip-path set an edge of the element's box to use as the clipping shape.

features.name: Custom formats for clipboard items
features.description: The web prefix for ClipboardItem data types (also known as MIME types) allows reading and writing ununsanitized custom data from the device clipboard.

features.name: Clipboard events
features.description: The "copy", "cut", and "paste" events fire on elements when the user starts an action with the clipboard.

features.name: ClipboardItem.supports()
features.description: The ClipboardItem.supports() static method checks if the browser supports writing data types such as "image/svg+xml" or other custom formats to the system clipboard.

features.name: SVG clipboard items
features.description: The image/svg+xml data type (also known as the MIME type) for ClipboardItem objects represents SVG data written to or read from the clipboard.

features.name: Read unsanitized clipboard data
features.description: The optional formats.unsanitized parameter of the navigator.clipboard.read() method reads unsanitized text/html data from the system clipboard.

features.name: CloseWatcher
features.description: The CloseWatcher API listens and responds to close requests on in-page components, such as modals, popovers, and sidebars.

features.name: <code>
features.description: The <code> element displays its contents as a fragment of computer code.

features.name: Color
features.description: The color CSS property sets the primary foreground color of an element, which is used for text, the default border color, and text decorations.

features.name: color-adjust
features.description: The color-adjust shorthand CSS property allows multiple performance related color adjustments to be set at once. Setting the print-color-adjust CSS property directly is preferred, as it is the only such adjustment so far defined.

features.name: color-contrast()
features.description: The color-contrast() CSS function picks a color from a list that has the most contrast with another color.

features.name: color()
features.description: The color() function picks a color from a given color space. Wide gamut color spaces like display-p3 allow showing more vibrant and saturated colors than the standard srgb color space.

features.name: color-gamut media query
features.description: The color-gamut media query sets styles based on the colors a device can display.

features.name: color-mix()
features.description: The color-mix() function mixes two colors in a given color space and by a given amount. Commonly, lighter or darker variations of a color are created by mixing with white or black.

features.name: color-scheme
features.description: The color-scheme CSS property sets which color schemes (light or dark) an element uses and may prevent automatic dark mode adjustments by the browser.

features.name: COLRv0
features.description: COLRv0 is a font format that supports multi-color glyphs. COLRv0 supports only solid colors.

features.name: COLRv1
features.description: COLRv1 is a font format that supports multi-color glyphs. COLRv1 extends COLRv0 to support gradients, transforms, and blending modes. Baseline availability blocked since November 2022 by Safari (32 months)

features.name: Column breaks
features.description: In columnar layouts (created by the columns or column-count CSS properties), the break-after, break-before, break-inside properties control where columns start or end.

features.name: column-fill
features.description: The column-fill CSS property sets the distribution of content across columns in a multi-column layout.

features.name: column-span
features.description: The column-span CSS property controls whether a child element extends across all columns of a multi-column parent.

features.name: Selection composed ranges
features.description: The window.getSelection().getComposedRanges() method returns ranges that represent the current user selection, even if the selection spans across shadow tree boundaries. Baseline availability blocked since May 2025 by Firefox (2 months)

features.name: Composition events
features.description: The compositionstart, compositionupdate, and compositionend events fire when an input method editor adds characters that might not be commonly available on keyboards. Examples of these characters are emoji, logograms in Asian languages, or input from speech recognition processors.

features.name: Compression Dictionary Transport
features.description: Compression Dictionary Transport is a mechanism for using designated HTTP responses as an external dictionary for future HTTP responses for compression schemes that support using external dictionaries (e.g., Brotli and Zstandard)

features.name: Compression streams
features.description: The CompressionStream and DecompressionStream interfaces compress and decompress data using the gzip or deflate formats.

features.name: CPU compute pressure
features.description: The PressureObserver API monitors CPU load, allowing you to adjust workloads in response to available computing resources. Also known as the Compute Pressure API.

safari_desktop.notes: Vendor position : oppose (concerns: privacy, device independence)

safari_ios.notes: Vendor position : oppose (concerns: privacy, device independence)

features.name: Conic gradients
features.description: The conic-gradient() and repeating-conic-gradient() CSS functions create backgrounds that progress between two or more colors around a center point.

features.name: Console
features.description: The console API logs debugging messages to the browser development tools' console.

features.name: Constraint validation API
features.description: Methods that validate form controls before submission, such as checkValidity(), reportValidity() and setCustomValidity().

features.name: Constructed stylesheets
features.description: The CSSStyleSheet constructor creates a new stylesheet which can be shared between a document and multiple shadow roots using adoptedStyleSheets.

features.name: Contact picker
features.description: The navigator.contacts API allows you to ask users to share limited details about entries in their contact list with your application.

features.name: contain
features.description: The contain CSS property sets limits to the scope of styles, layout, and paint rendering for speed and efficiency. The none keyword value disables containment, strict is equivalent to contain: size layout style paint, and content is equivalent to contain: layout style paint.

features.name: Inline-size containment
features.description: The contain: inline-size CSS declaration prevents the element's inline dimension from being set by the element's contents. This permits the browser to avoid slower layout calculations.

features.name: contain-intrinsic-size
features.description: The contain-intrinsic-size CSS property sets the intrinsic size of an element. When using size containment, the browser will lay out the element as if it had a single child of this size.

features.name: Layout containment
features.description: The contain: layout CSS declaration isolates the inside of an element such that it cannot affect the layout of the rest of the page or be affected by the rest of the page. This permits the browser to avoid slower layout calculations.

features.name: Paint containment
features.description: The contain: paint CSS declaration prevents an element's descendants from being drawn outside the boundaries of the containing element, with any overflow clipped. This permits the browser to avoid slower painting calculations.

features.name: Size containment
features.description: The contain: size CSS declaration sets an element's dimensions exclusively by its height and width properties, ignoring its contents and descendants. This permits the browser to avoid slower layout calculations.

features.name: Style containment
features.description: The contain: style CSS declaration permits the browser to avoid slower layout calculations by preventing modification to counter (counter-increment and counter-set) and quotation styles (content property quote values) beyond the element's descendants.

features.name: Container queries
features.description: Container size queries with the @container at-rule apply styles to an element based on the dimensions of its container.

features.name: Container scroll-state queries
features.description: Container scroll-state queries with the @container scroll-state(...) at-rule apply styles to an element based on the sticky positioning, snapped, and scrollable state of the container.

features.name: Container style queries
features.description: Container style queries with the @container at-rule apply styles to an element based on the values of custom properties of its container. Baseline availability blocked since September 2024 by Firefox (10 months)

features.name: Content
features.description: The content CSS property sets the content inside of an element or pseudo-element, replacing the current value. It's often used with the ::before and ::after pseudo-elements to generate cosmetic content.

features.name: Content Index
features.description: The Content Index API allows developers to register their offline enabled content with the browser.

features.name: content-visibility
features.description: The content-visibility CSS property delays rendering an element, including layout and painting, until it is needed. Baseline availability blocked since September 2024 by Safari (10 months)

features.name: contenteditable
features.description: The contenteditable global HTML attribute allows the user to edit the content of an element, such as inserting or deleting text.

features.name: contenteditable="plaintext-only"
features.description: The contenteditable="plaintext-only" global HTML attribute allows the user to edit the content of an element, but prevents rich-text formatting.

features.name: context-fill and context-stroke
features.description: The context-fill and context-stroke CSS values are used with fill and stroke in SVG <marker> or <use> elements to match a color from where they appear. Baseline availability blocked since April 2024 by Safari (15 months)

features.name: contrast-color()
features.description: The contrast-color() CSS function picks a color that has guaranteed contrast against a specified foreground or background color.

features.name: controlslist
features.description: The controlslist attribute for <audio> or <video> hides parts of the browser's built-in controls. For example, controlslist="nofullscreen" removes the button to play the video in fullscreen.

features.name: cookieEnabled
features.description: The navigator.cookieEnabled property is a boolean for whether the browser accepts or ignores attempts to write cookie data.

features.name: Cookie store
features.description: The CookieStore interface is an asynchronous and promise-based API for managing cookies. It does not rely on document and so is available to service workers as well.

safari_desktop.notes: Vendor position : blocked (concerns: complexity, integration, API design)

safari_ios.notes: Vendor position : blocked (concerns: complexity, integration, API design)

features.name: Cookies
features.description: The Set-Cookie HTTP header stores limited amounts of data that persist across request and response, creating shared state between the browser and server.

features.name: CORS
features.description: Cross-Origin Resource Sharing is an HTTP-header based mechanism that allows a server to indicate any origins (domain, scheme, or port) other than its own from which a browser should permit loading resources. Also known as CORS.

features.name: Reversed counter-reset
features.description: The reversed() CSS function for counter-reset creates a counter that counts down.

features.name: counter-set
features.description: The counter-set CSS property creates (and optionally sets a value for) a counter, the numbers for a series of headings or ordered list items.

features.name: Counters (CSS)
features.description: The counter-reset and counter-increment CSS properties and the counter() and counters() functions automatically number headings or ordered list items.

features.name: createImageBitmap
features.description: The createImageBitmap() global method creates an ImageBitmap object from a source such as an image, SVG, blob, or canvas. An ImageBitmap object represents pixel data that can be drawn to a canvas with lower latency than other types, such as ImageData. Baseline availability blocked since December 2023 by Firefox (19 months)

features.name: Credential management
features.description: The navigator.credentials API provides generic storage for authentication credentials. Other credential APIs represent specific kinds of credentials, such as password or public key credentials, that the credential management API stores.

features.name: crisp-edges
features.description: The image-rendering: crisp-edges CSS declaration scales images to preserve lines without blurring.

features.name: Cross-document view transitions
features.description: The @view-transition CSS rule sets whether a document opts-in to transitions between documents in a multi-page application. Both the old and new document must opt-in for a transition to be triggered. Baseline availability blocked since December 2024 by Firefox (7 months)

features.name: cross-fade()
features.description: The cross-fade() CSS function generates an image by mixing two images.

features.name: Content Security Policy (CSP)
features.description: Content Security Policy (CSP) helps to mitigate certain security threats, including cross-site scripting (XSS) and clickjacking attacks. It consists of a set of directives from a website to a browser, which instruct the browser to restrict the things that the site is allowed to do.

features.name: CSS.escape()
features.description: The CSS.escape() static method escapes a string so that it can be used in a valid CSS selector.

features.name: CSS import attributes
features.description: Module import â€¦ with { type: "css" } statements load CSS modules as constructable stylesheets. Also known as CSS module scripts.

features.name: CSS object model
features.description: The CSS object model API reads, creates, and modifies CSS stylesheets and inline styles. Also known as CSSOM.

features.name: CSS object model (DOM level 2)
features.description: The DOM level 2 style specification defined interfaces to access and modify CSS styles, such as CSSValue and CSSPrimitiveValue, that were later excluded from the CSS object model.

features.name: CSS.supports()
features.description: The CSS.supports() static method returns whether the browser supports a CSS declaration (given by two arguments, a property and value) or an @supports at-rule condition string.

features.name: CSS typed object model
features.description: The CSSStyleValue and its subclasses represent CSS values as distinct types instead of only strings. Also known as typed OM. Baseline availability blocked since March 2023 by Firefox (28 months)

features.name: cubic-bezier() easing
features.description: The cubic-bezier() CSS easing function interpolates along a smooth curve, creating animations and transitions with continuous changes in speed. The ease, ease-in, ease-out, and ease-in-out keyword values are presets for common BÃ©zier curves.

features.name: currentColor
features.description: The currentColor CSS value allows you to reuse an element's computed text color for other properties.

features.name: Cursor styles
features.description: The cursor CSS property styles the pointer, allowing you to provide hints to the user on how to interact with the hovered element. Baseline availability blocked since December 2021 by Safari on iOS (43 months)

features.name: Custom ellipses
features.description: The text-overflow CSS property with a string value sets the string representing clipped text.

features.name: Custom properties
features.description: Custom properties are CSS properties prefixed with -- that set values you can reuse with the var() function. For example, you can set a --key-color property to reuse as border-color: var(--key-color). Also known as CSS variables.

features.name: Customizable <select>
features.description: The <select> element's appearance, including the button, selected option, picker dropdown, and options, can be customized using CSS.

features.name: Customized built-in elements
features.description: Customized built-in elements are HTML elements that extend built-in elements using the is attribute, to add new behaviors that you define. Baseline availability blocked since January 2020 by Safari (66 months)

features.name: <data>
features.description: The <data> element links a given piece of content with a machine-readable translation.

features.name: Data URLs
features.description: Data URLs are URLs that start with the data: scheme and which directly contain data rather than point to remote resources.

features.name: <datalist>
features.description: The <datalist> element sets recommended values for an <input> element. Browsers may show a dropdown menu of all values or match values as the user types. Baseline availability blocked since February 2023 by Firefox for Android (29 months)

features.name: Dataset
features.description: The dataset API attaches and accesses custom data on elements, using either the dataset property of HTMLElement or attributes prefixed with data-.

features.name: Date
features.description: The Date object represents a single moment in time.

features.name: getYear() and setYear()
features.description: The getYear() and setYear() methods of Date objects get and set the year as an offset to 1900.

features.name: toGMTString()
features.description: The toGMTString() method of Date objects is an alias to the toUTCString() method.

features.name: Declarative shadow DOM
features.description: The shadowrootmode attribute on <template> creates a shadow root without the use of JavaScript. It is a declarative alternative to the attachShadow() method.

features.name: Dedicated workers
features.description: The Worker() constructor runs a script in its own thread, which can send and receive messages with the script that created it. Also known as web workers.

features.name: <del>
features.description: The <del> element element represents a range of text that has been deleted from a document, styling text as strikethrough by default.

features.name: Description list
features.description: The <dl>, <dt>, and <dd> HTML elements represent a list of terms and their associated descriptions. Use a description list to create glossaries or similar list of key-value pairs.

features.name: Destructuring
features.description: The destructuring assignment syntax is a JavaScript expression that unpacks values from arrays, or properties from objects, into distinct variables.

features.name: <details>
features.description: The <details> element is a disclosure widget which can be expanded to reveal additional content. When closed, only the nested <summary> element is visible.

features.name: Mutually exclusive <details> elements
features.description: Multiple <details> elements which use the same name attribute are mutually exclusive. When one member of the group is opened, all other members are closed.

features.name: Device memory
features.description: The navigator.deviceMemory property is the approximate amount of device memory, in gigabytes.

features.name: Device orientation events
features.description: The DeviceMotion and DeviceOrientation events report the movement and orientation of the browser's device in physical space. Note that coordinates can differ noticeably between platforms and devices.

features.name: Device posture
features.description: The device posture API provides information about the physical posture of a device, such as whether a foldable device is folded or unfolded.

features.name: Device media queries
features.description: The device-aspect-ratio, device-height, and device-width media features describe physical properties of the displaying output device.

features.name: devicePixelRatio
features.description: The window.devicePixelRatio property is the ratio of the size of one CSS pixel to the vertical size of one physical pixel on the current display device. Baseline availability blocked since July 2015 by Safari (120 months)

features.name: <dfn>
features.description: The <dfn> element marks a term to be defined, styling text as italic by default.

features.name: <dialog>
features.description: The <dialog> HTML element represents a modal or non-modal dialog box, such as a confirmation prompt or a subwindow used to enter data.

features.name: <dialog closedby>
features.description: The closedby HTML attribute for <dialog> sets which user actions close a dialog. For example, closedby="any" allows the dialog to be closed by clicking outside of it.

features.name: Digital goods
features.description: The window.getDigitalGoodsService API connects to stores or billing services for in-app products and subscriptions.

features.name: dirname
features.description: The dirname attribute of <textarea> and <input> HTML elements includes the field's writing direction as form data on submission.

features.name: Display
features.description: The display CSS property sets the display behavior of an element's box within its layout and sets the layout behavior for its child elements.

features.name: display animation
features.description: You can animate elements between display: none and any other display value or animate between content-visibility: hidden and any other content-visibility value. This also applies to transitions. Baseline availability blocked since September 2024 by Firefox (10 months)

features.name: display: contents
features.description: The display: contents CSS declaration sets an element to display only its contents, not itself.

features.name: display: flow-root
features.description: The display: flow-root CSS declaration sets an element as the root element of a new flow layout for its children, preventing margin collapse with sibling elements.

features.name: display: list-item
features.description: The display: list-item CSS declaration renders an element with the box layout of a <li> HTML element.

features.name: display-mode media query
features.description: The display-mode CSS media query sets styles based on whether the web page is in fullscreen, standalone, minimal-ui, browser, or picture-in-picture mode.

features.name: display: ruby
features.description: The display: ruby CSS declaration renders an element with the box layout of a <ruby> HTML element. Child elements may use equivalents to <ruby> internal elements such as display: ruby-base for <rb>.

features.name: display: table
features.description: The display: table CSS declaration renders an element with the box layout of a <table> HTML element. Child elements may use equivalents to <table> internal elements such as display: table-row for <tr>.

features.name: <div>
features.description: The <div> HTML element is the generic container for content.

features.name: document.caretPositionFromPoint()
features.description: The document.caretPositionFromPoint() method finds an insertion point, represented by a DOM node and an offset within that node, for given coordinates in the viewport. Baseline availability blocked since August 2024 by Safari (11 months)

features.name: Document colors
features.description: A document's bgColor, fgColor, alinkColor, linkColor, and vlinkColor properties get and set the background, foreground, active link, link, and visited link colors of that document.

features.name: Document picture-in-picture
features.description: The document picture-in-picture API creates an always-on-top window from arbitrary HTML content.

features.name: document.write()
features.description: The document.open(), document.write(), document.writeln(), and document.close() methods write content to a document, possibly while that document is still loading.

features.name: DOM
features.description: The DOM (Document Object Model) API represents HTML and XML documents as trees of nodes. You can use the API to inspect and modify the structure and content of a document.

features.name: DOM Geometry
features.description: The DOMMatrix, DOMPoint, DOMQuad and DOMRect interfaces offer a way to represent points, rectangles, quadrilaterals and transformation matrices within JavaScript. They can be used in transformations in CSS, <canvas>, and SVG.

features.name: dominant-baseline
features.description: The dominant-baseline CSS property sets the specific baseline used to align an elements's text and inline-level contents.

features.name: DOMParser
features.description: The DOMParser API parses XML or HTML source code from a string into a DOM Document.

features.name: download
features.description: The download attribute for <a> elements loads the target URL as a file to be saved, instead of navigating to it. An optional attribute value sets a default file name.

features.name: Drag and Drop
features.description: The Drag and Drop API lets users drag and drop elements and external files such as images onto web pages. Developers can customize which elements can become draggable, the type of feedback the draggable elements produce, and the droppable elements.

features.name: dynamic-range media query
features.description: The dynamic-range CSS media query sets styles based on whether a device can display at least standard range colors or at least high range colors. Non-visual devices will match neither.

features.name: Early data
features.description: TLS 1.3 sessions may be resumed more quickly by sending so-called early data to servers before the TLS handshake has finished. Also known as zero round-trip time resumption or 0-RTT.

features.name: EditContext
features.description: The EditContext API allows you to build rich text editors that support advanced text input, such as Input Method Editor (IME) composition, an emoji picker, or other platform-specific editing UI.

features.name: element()
features.description: The element() CSS function creates a live-updating image from an HTML element that can be used as an image or background image.

features.name: Element capture
features.description: The restrictTo() method on screen capture media tracks limits capture to a specific element, excluding content which might occlude the element itself, such as video conferencing controls.

features.name: document.elementFromPoint() and document.elementsFromPoint()
features.description: The document.elementFromPoint() and document.elementsFromPoint() methods find the top-most element at a given point in the viewport, or all elements at a given point in the viewport, respectively.

features.name: Element timing
features.description: The element performance entry and the PerformanceElementTiming API measures the time to render elements that have the elementtiming attribute.

features.name: <em>
features.description: The <em> HTML element emphasizes or stresses the content, styling text as italic by default.

features.name: em unit
features.description: The em CSS length unit is a font-relative length equal to the specified font size. In an element with a 2 inch font, 1em equals 2 inches.

features.name: <embed>
features.description: The <embed> element represents an external resource such as a PDF or SVG document. It was historically used for plugins such as Shockwave Flash.

features.name: Encrypted media extensions
features.description: The mediaKeys property of HTMLMediaElement and the navigator.requestMediaKeySystemAccess() method control the playback of content subject to digital rights management. Also known as EME.

features.name: enterkeyhint
features.description: The enterkeyhint global HTML attribute sets the label for a virtual keyboard's Enter key. For example, enterkeyhint="search" may label the key with a magnifying glass icon.

features.name: Error cause
features.description: The cause property of errors records the specific original cause of the error, particularly for errors that have been re-thrown.

features.name: escape() and unescape()
features.description: The escape() and unescape() built-in Javascript methods encode and unencode strings using percent encoding, where certain characters are replaced by hexadecimal escape sequences.

features.name: Event timing
features.description: The event and first-input performance entries and the PerformanceEventTiming API measures the latency of user input events, such as mouse clicks or keypresses, and the latency of the first user input. First Input Delay (FID) is a common metric for perceived responsiveness. Baseline availability blocked since June 2021 by Safari (49 months)

features.name: Events
features.description: The Event API and the addEventListener() method on objects that receive events (event targets) represent and handle significant things happening on a page. Many APIs fire events for a wide range of situations relating to those APIs, such as an image loading, a user clicking, or a value changing.

features.name: ex unit
features.description: The ex CSS length unit is a font-relative length equal to the used x-height of the first available font. X-height is often equal to the height of the lowercase x.

features.name: execCommand()
features.description: The execCommand() method reads and writes from the clipboard and performs editing commands on editable text, such as changing the font name or style. Related methods check whether commands are supported, enabled, or applied.

features.name: pow(), sqrt(), hypot(), log(), and exp()
features.description: The pow(), sqrt(), hypot(), log(), and exp() CSS functions compute various exponential functions.

features.name: Exponentiation operator
features.description: The exponentiation (**) operator returns the result of raising the first operand to the power of the second operand.

features.name: EXT_blend_minmax WebGL extension
features.description: The EXT_blend_minmax extension for WebGL 1.0 contexts adds two blend equations, the minimum and maximum color components of the source and destination colors.

features.name: EXT_color_buffer_float WebGL extension
features.description: The EXT_color_buffer_float extension for WebGL 2.0 contexts adds color-renderable floating point formats to renderbufferStorage().

features.name: EXT_color_buffer_half_float WebGL extension
features.description: The EXT_color_buffer_half_float extension for WebGL 1.0 and 2.0 contexts renders 16-bit floating-point color buffers.

features.name: EXT_disjoint_timer_query WebGL extension
features.description: The EXT_disjoint_timer_query extension for WebGL 1.0 contexts measures the duration of a set of GL commands, without stalling the rendering pipeline.

features.name: EXT_float_blend WebGL extension
features.description: The EXT_float_blend extension for WebGL 1.0 and 2.0 contexts adds 32-bit floating-point components to blending and draw buffers. Baseline availability blocked since April 2021 by Safari on iOS (51 months)

features.name: EXT_frag_depth WebGL extension
features.description: The EXT_frag_depth extension for WebGL 1.0 and 2.0 contexts adds setting the depth value of a fragment from within the fragment shader. Baseline availability blocked since September 2021 by Firefox for Android (46 months)

features.name: EXT_shader_texture_lod WebGL extension
features.description: The EXT_shader_texture_lod extension for WebGL 1.0 and 2.0 contexts adds texture functions to the OpenGL ES Shading Language such that the shader writer explicitly controls of the level of detail (LOD). Baseline availability blocked since September 2021 by Firefox for Android (46 months)

features.name: EXT_sRGB WebGL extension
features.description: The EXT_sRGB extension for WebGL 1.0 contexts adds sRGB support to textures and framebuffer objects.

features.name: EXT_texture_compression_bptc WebGL extension
features.description: The EXT_texture_compression_bptc extension for WebGL 1.0 and 2.0 contexts adds the BPTC compressed texture formats to compressedTexImage2D() and compressedTexSubImage2D().

features.name: EXT_texture_compression_rgtc WebGL extension
features.description: The EXT_texture_compression_rgtc extension for WebGL 1.0 and 2.0 contexts adds RGTC compressed texture formats. RGTC is a block-based texture compression format suited for unsigned and signed red and red-green textures. Also known as Red-Green Texture Compression.

features.name: EXT_texture_filter_anisotropic WebGL extension
features.description: The EXT_texture_filter_anisotropic extension for WebGL 1.0 and 2.0 contexts adds anisotropic filtering (AF). AF improves the quality of mipmapped texture access when viewing a textured primitive at an oblique angle.

features.name: EXT_texture_norm16 WebGL extension
features.description: The EXT_texture_norm16 extension to WebGL 2.0 contexts adds 16 bit signed normalized and unsigned normalized fixed-point texture, renderbuffer, and texture buffer formats. Baseline availability blocked since September 2022 by Firefox (34 months)

features.name: window.external
features.description: The window.external.AddSearchProvider() and window.external.IsSearchProviderInstalled() do nothing. Historically, they added external search providers to the browser. Baseline availability blocked since July 2015 by Safari (120 months)

features.name: Eyedropper
features.description: The EyeDropper API opens an eyedropper tool, a color picker that allows users to select a color from their screen.

features.name: fastSeek()
features.description: The fastSeek() method seeks an <audio> or <video> element as fast as possible, by seeking to a keyframe instead of exactly the requested time.

features.name: Federated credential management
features.description: The IdentityCredential API delegates authentication to a third-party identity provider, instead of using third-party cookies. Also known as FedCM.

features.name: Federated credentials
features.description: The FederatedCredential API represents the details required to authenticate a user using a third-party identity provider. Not to be confused with federated credential management (FedCM).

features.name: <fencedframe>
features.description: The <fencedframe> element embeds another HTML page into the current page in a more secure and privacy-preserving way than <iframe> elements.

features.name: Fetch
features.description: The fetch() method makes asynchronous HTTP requests.

features.name: Fetch metadata request headers
features.description: The Sec-Fetch-Dest, Sec-Fetch-Mode, Sec-Fetch-Site, and Sec-Fetch-User HTTP headers provide extra information about the way a request was made, to help servers reject certain kinds of malicious requests.

features.name: Fetch priority
features.description: The fetch() priority option and the fetchpriority HTML attribute give hints to the browser about which requests to do before other requests of the same type.

features.name: Fetch upload streams
features.description: A fetch() request uploads a stream of data to the server when a request's body property is a ReadableStream object. Baseline availability blocked since September 2022 by Firefox (34 months)

features.name: fetchLater
features.description: The fetchLater() method requests a deferred fetch sent at an unknown time. The browser chooses a reliable time to send the request, ideally when the document is unloaded, and ignores the response. This API is useful for sending beacons to a server without expecting a particular response.

safari_desktop.notes: Vendor position : support (concerns: complexity, privacy, integration, venue, API design, maintenance)

safari_ios.notes: Vendor position : support (concerns: complexity, privacy, integration, venue, API design, maintenance)

features.name: field-sizing
features.description: The field-sizing CSS property allows form controls such as <textarea> to be sized based on their content.

features.name: <fieldset> and <legend>
features.description: The <fieldset> and <legend> elements group several form control elements within a web form.

features.name: <figure> and <figcaption>
features.description: The <figure> and <figcaption> HTML elements represent an illustration, diagram, text, or other self-contained reference content, with an optional caption.

features.name: File API
features.description: The File API represents and reads from file data and metadata. Typically, you get files through other APIs, such as the <input type="file"> element or drag-and-drop events. You may also send file data to other APIs, such as creating images or drawing on canvases.

features.name: File system access
features.description: The showOpenFilePicker(), showDirectoryPicker(), and showSaveFilePicker() methods request access to files and directories on the user's device and returns a handle for reading and writing to them.

features.name: filter
features.description: The filter CSS property applies one or more graphic effects to an element. You can use filter functions, such as blur() and drop-shadow(), alone or combined to produce different effects.

features.name: fit-content
features.description: The fit-content CSS keyword expands a box as needed to fit its contents until the maximum size is reached, preserving the content's preferred aspect ratio.

features.name: fit-content()
features.description: The fit-content() CSS function, used outside of a grid layout property, clamps a length between min-content and max-content.

features.name: Fixed positioning
features.description: The position: fixed CSS declaration removes an element from the normal flow and positions it relative to the viewport or page.

features.name: Flexbox
features.description: Flexbox is a one-dimensional layout system, which places content either horizontally or vertically, with optional wrapping.

features.name: Flexbox gap
features.description: The gap CSS property in a flexbox layout sets the size of the space between items.

features.name: float and clear
features.description: The float CSS property aligns an element to either side of its container, allowing text and inline elements to flow around it. The clear CSS property sets whether an element is moved below floating elements that proceed it.

features.name: Float16Array
features.description: Float16Array is a typed array of 16-bit floating point numbers.

features.name: Focus events
features.description: Focus events, such as focus and blur, fire when an element gets or loses focus.

features.name: font-display
features.description: The font-display CSS descriptor sets whether to show a substitute font or nothing while a font face loads. The property manages what's known as a flash of unstyled text or flash of invisible text.

features.name: font-family
features.description: The font-family CSS property sets the desired font face for text, along with optional fallback font faces.

features.name: Math font family
features.description: The font-family: math CSS declaration uses the browser default font face for displaying mathematical expressions.

features.name: System font
features.description: The font-family: system-ui CSS declaration uses the operating system default font for text.

features.name: UI fonts
features.description: The ui-serif, ui-sans-serif, ui-monospace and ui-rounded values for the font-family CSS property use device-default user interface fonts for text.

features.name: font-feature-settings
features.description: The font-feature-settings CSS property sets low-level OpenType feature tags for a font. When possible, use font-variant instead.

features.name: font-kerning
features.description: The font-kerning CSS property sets whether kerning data from a font is used to adjust the space between letters.

features.name: font-language-override
features.description: The font-language-override CSS property sets which language-specific glyphs are displayed.

features.name: Font loading
features.description: The document.fonts API dynamically loads custom fonts and tracks when fonts are loading or ready to use.

features.name: Font metric overrides
features.description: The ascent-override, descent-override, and line-gap-override descriptors adjust the display of a font declared in an @font-face statement. This can help make fallback fonts look the same size. Baseline availability blocked since June 2021 by Safari (49 months)

features.name: font-optical-sizing
features.description: The font-optical-sizing CSS property sets whether text rendering is optimized for viewing at different sizes.

features.name: font-palette
features.description: The font-palette CSS property selects a color palette from the font, optionally overriding individual colors in the @font-palette-values at-rule.

features.name: font-palette animation
features.description: You can animate color fonts between two font-palette values.

features.name: Font shorthand
features.description: The font CSS property shorthand sets multiple font properties, including style, weight, size, and font family.

features.name: font-size
features.description: The font-size CSS property sets the text height.

features.name: font-size-adjust
features.description: The font-size-adjust CSS property preserves apparent text size, regardless of the font used, by scaling fonts to the same size with respect to a specific metric, such as x-height. This can help make fallback fonts look the same size.

features.name: font-stretch
features.description: The font-stretch CSS property selects a font face from a font family based on width, either by a keyword such as condensed or a percentage.

features.name: font-style
features.description: The font-style CSS property sets the text style, with normal, italic, and oblique options.

features.name: font-synthesis
features.description: The font-synthesis CSS shorthand property disables all font synthesis except the given kinds. To disable a specific kind of font synthesis, instead use the longhand properties such as font-synthesis-style and font-synthesis-weight.

features.name: font-synthesis-position
features.description: The font-synthesis-position CSS property sets whether or not the browser should synthesize subscript and superscript typefaces when they're missing from the font.

features.name: font-synthesis-small-caps
features.description: The font-synthesis-small-caps CSS property sets whether or not the browser should synthesize small caps typefaces when they're missing from the font.

features.name: font-synthesis-style
features.description: The font-synthesis-style CSS property sets whether or not the browser should synthesize italic and oblique typefaces when they're missing from the font.

features.name: font-synthesis-weight
features.description: The font-synthesis-weight CSS property sets whether or not the browser should synthesize bold typefaces when they're missing from the font.

features.name: font-variant
features.description: The font-variant CSS property is a shorthand for font-variant-alternates, font-variant-caps, font-variant-east-asian, font-variant-emoji, font-variant-ligatures, font-variant-numeric, and font-variant-position.

features.name: font-variant-alternates
features.description: The font-variant-alternates CSS property, along with the @font-feature-values at-rule, chooses when to use a font's alternate glyphs.

features.name: font-variant-caps
features.description: The font-variant-caps CSS property sets whether text should be displayed in small caps, petite caps, or with capital letters designed for titles.

features.name: font-variant-east-asian
features.description: The font-variant-east-asian CSS property controls glyph substitution and sizing in East Asian text.

features.name: font-variant-emoji
features.description: The font-variant-emoji CSS property sets the default presentation for emoji characters.

features.name: font-variant-ligatures
features.description: The font-variant-ligatures CSS property sets how characters can be visually combined for readability or stylistic reasons.

features.name: font-variant-numeric
features.description: The font-variant-numeric CSS property sets how numeric characters are displayed. For example, you can align columns of numbers or use zeroes that have a slash.

features.name: font-variant-position
features.description: The font-variant-position CSS property sets whether to use alternate glyphs for subscript and superscript text.

features.name: font-variation-settings
features.description: The font-variation-settings CSS property sets an "axis of variability" on a variable font, such as weight, optical size, or a custom axis defined by the typeface designer. When possible, use other CSS font properties, such as font-weight: bold. Also known as variable fonts.

features.name: font-weight
features.description: The font-weight CSS property controls the thickness of a font. It is set explicitly with the keyword bold or a number, or relative to the inherited thickness with the keywords bolder or lighter.

features.name: font-width
features.description: The font-width CSS property selects a font face from a font family based on width, either by a keyword such as condensed or a percentage.

features.name: Forced colors
features.description: The forced-colors CSS @media rule detects when a user has chosen to use a forced colors mode, also known as high-contrast mode, and the forced-color-adjust CSS property sets whether forced colors apply to an element.

features.name: <form>
features.description: The <form> element contains interactive controls for submitting information.

features.name: Form-associated custom elements
features.description: Custom elements may act like built-in form elements, via the the attachInternals() method of HTMLElement and the ElementInternals API.

features.name: Form validity pseudo-classes
features.description: The form validity CSS pseudo-classes match <form> elements based on the constraints of a form field, such as validity (:valid, :invalid, :in-range, :out-of-range) and necessity (:optional or :required).

features.name: Fullscreen API
features.description: The fullscreen API makes a specific element fill the whole screen and hides most browser UI. Baseline availability blocked since March 2023 by Safari on iOS (28 months)

features.name: Functions
features.description: Functions are series of statements that can be called and return a value. The function keyword (as in function () { }) and arrow (=>) expression create functions. The JavaScript functions protocol includes default and rest parameters and binding to this.

features.name: Function caller and arguments
features.description: The caller and arguments properties of a non-strict mode Function object are the function that called it and the arguments it was called with. Not to be confused with the arguments variable in a function body's local scope.

features.name: Gamepad
features.description: The navigator.getGamepads() API accesses and responds to signals from game controllers.

features.name: Gamepad haptic feedback
features.description: The gamepad.vibrationActuator property represents a gamepad's haptics hardware, which allows you to control the vibration motors in a gamepad.

features.name: Gamepad touch buttons
features.description: The touched property of a GamepadButton object indicates whether a button capable of detecting touch is currently touched. Baseline availability blocked since March 2019 by Safari (76 months)

features.name: Gamepad VR hands and poses
features.description: The hand and pose properties of a Gamepad object represent the position in space and the hand that WebVR controllers are held in.

features.name: Gap decorations
features.description: The column-rule and row-rule CSS properties display decorative lines between columns and rows of a flex, grid, or multi-column layout. The rule-break, rule-outset, and rule-paint-order properties control the appearance of these lines.

features.name: Generators
features.description: Generator functions (function*) create iterators that return multiple values, one after another, on-demand.

features.name: Geolocation
features.description: The navigator.gelocation API requests the user's latitude, longitude, heading, and speed.

features.name: getComputedStyle()
features.description: The getComputedStyle() global method returns an CSSStyleDeclaration object that represents all CSS declarations applied to a given element.

features.name: getBoxQuads()
features.description: The getBoxQuads() method, when called on a document, element, pseudo-element, or text node, returns the list of DOMQuad objects that represent the CSS boxes used to render the node.

features.name: getHTML()
features.description: The getHTML() method of Element and ShadowRoot objects serializes an element's DOM to an HTML string.

features.name: globalThis
features.description: The globalThis property accesses the global this value (and hence the global object itself) across environments.

features.name: glyph-orientation-vertical
features.description: The glyph-orientation-vertical CSS property sets the orientation of glyphs in text rendered in a vertical writing mode.

features.name: Global privacy control
features.description: The Sec-GPC request header indicates that the user does not consent to a website or service selling or sharing their personal information with third parties.

features.name: Gradient interpolation
features.description: Gradient interpolation controls how the colors between gradient stops are calculated in CSS. For example, linear-gradient(to right in oklch longer hue, red, red); calculates in the oklch color space, with the hue going all the way around the hue circle from red back to red.

features.name: Gradients
features.description: The linear-gradient() and radial-gradient() CSS functions and their repeating counterparts create backgrounds that progress smoothly between multiple colors.

features.name: Grid
