features.description: The scrollsnapchanging and scrollsnapchange events fire when a scroll gesture changes the selected scroll snap target.

features.name: Scroll to text fragment
features.description: Text fragments are URL fragments on the form #:~:text=snippet and link to a snippet of text within a page. The browser may scroll, highlight, or otherwise bring that text to the reader's attention.

features.name: scrollbar-color
features.description: The scrollbar-color CSS property sets the color of the scrollbar track and thumb. Baseline availability blocked since January 2024 by Safari (18 months)

features.name: scrollbar-gutter
features.description: The scrollbar-gutter CSS property reserves space for the scrollbar, preventing unwanted layout changes as the scrollbar appears and disappears.

features.name: scrollbar-width
features.description: The scrollbar-width CSS property sets the width of the scrollbar.

features.name: scrollend
features.description: The scrollend event fires when an element or document has finished scrolling. Baseline availability blocked since June 2023 by Safari (25 months)

features.name: <search>
features.description: The <search> HTML element is a container that represents the parts of the web page with search functionality.

features.name: <input type="search">
features.description: The <input type="search"> HTML element represents a text field for search queries.

features.name: <section>
features.description: The <section> element is a generic standalone section of a document, which doesn't have a more specific semantic element to represent it.

features.name: <select>
features.description: The <select> element provides a menu of options for a user to pick from, typically rendered as a dropdown list.

features.name: Selection
features.description: The Selection API controls and modifies user text selections within the page.

features.name: Selectors (core)
features.description: CSS selectors match elements based on their type, attributes, and relationship to other elements. They define the specific elements to which a block of styles will be applied. This feature represents the oldest selectors of CSS.

features.name: Web serial
features.description: The navigator.serial API communicates with devices over serial ports, such as microcontrollers.

features.name: Serializable errors
features.description: The DOMException, Error, EvalError, RangeError, ReferenceError, SyntaxError, TypeError, and URIError objects are serializable. You can call structuredClone() on an error object or pass it to a worker using postMessage(). Baseline availability blocked since July 2022 by Safari (36 months)

features.name: Server-sent events
features.description: The EventSource API creates a connection to a server and listens to a stream of events sent by the server.

features.name: Server timing
features.description: The serverTiming property of the PerformanceResourceTiming API contains server timing information about network requests.

features.name: Service workers
features.description: The service worker of a website is a script that runs in its own thread and which acts as local proxy that intercepts network requests from the website. Use a service worker to implement advanced caching strategies, offline support, background tasks, or push notification support on your website.

features.name: Set (initial support)
features.description: Set objects store unique values of any type.

features.name: Set methods
features.description: The difference(), intersection(), isDisjointFrom(), isSubsetOf(), isSupersetOf(), symmetricDifference(), and union() methods of the JavaScript Set object performs operations between two sets.

features.name: setInterval
features.description: The setInterval() global function repeatedly executes provided code on a given delay, and the accompanying clearInterval() cancels the interval.

features.name: setTimeout()
features.description: The setTimeout() global function executes provided code after a given duration of time, and the accompanying clearTimeout() cancels the timer.

features.name: Shadow DOM
features.description: Shadow DOM allows you to attach encapsulated "shadow" DOM trees to elements. A shadow DOM tree is a separate component, isolated from the scripts and styles in other parts of the document. This is a part of Web Components.

features.name: Shadow parts
features.description: The part and exportparts HTML attributes expose elements of a shadow DOM as named parts, which can be selected by the ::part() CSS pseudo-element for styling.

features.name: shape-outside
features.description: The shape-outside CSS property, along with shape-margin and shape-image-threshold, sets the shape around which adjacent content will wrap.

features.name: shapes
features.description: The circle(), ellipse(), inset(), polygon(), rect(), and xywh() CSS shape functions create shapes for use with clip-path and shape-outside.

features.name: navigator.share()
features.description: The navigator.share() method invokes the device's native sharing mechanism and passes text, links, files, and other content to share targets. Baseline availability blocked since August 2024 by Firefox (11 months)

features.name: SharedArrayBuffer and Atomics
features.description: The SharedArrayBuffer object represents bytes shared between multiple workers and the main thread. The Atomics object safely accesses SharedArrayBuffer data to make sure predictable values are read and written and that operations are not interrupted.

features.name: Shared storage
features.description: The sharedStorage API stores data to a shared space where the data can then be processed without the ability to track users across the different sites they visit. A common use case is measuring the reach of third-party ads without using user-tracking cookies."

safari_desktop.notes: Vendor position (concerns: complexity, interoperability, privacy, dependencies)

safari_ios.notes: Vendor position (concerns: complexity, interoperability, privacy, dependencies)

features.name: Shared storage locks
features.description: The withLock option to set(), append(), delete(), clear(), and batchUpdate() methods of the sharedStorage API prevents duplicate reporting from cross-site race conditions.

features.name: Shared worker
features.description: The SharedWorker() constructor runs a script in its own thread, which can send and receive messages with other scripts running at the same origin. Baseline availability blocked since September 2022 by Chrome Android (34 months)

features.name: showPicker() for <input>
features.description: The showPicker() method for <input> elements shows the user interface for picking a value. For example, for <input type="date"> it shows the interface for picking a date. Baseline availability blocked since March 2024 by Safari on iOS (16 months)

features.name: showPicker() for <select>
features.description: The showPicker() method for <select> elements shows the dropdown menu or other user interface for picking one of the options. Baseline availability blocked since January 2024 by Safari (18 months)

features.name: sibling-count() and sibling-index()
features.description: The sibling-count() and sibling-index() CSS functions return integers that are useful to style elements based on their positions among siblings or on the number of siblings, for example as part of a calc() expression.

features.name: Single color stop gradients
features.description: A single color stop can be provided to the linear-gradient(), radial-gradient(), and conic-gradient() CSS functions, and their repeating counterparts, to create a solid color background.

The sizes="auto" attribute for the HTML element reserves layout space for an image before it loads, avoiding some layout shifts. This attribute only applies to images with the loading="lazy" attribute.

features.name: <slot>
features.description: The <slot> HTML element is a placeholder inside a web component where consumers of the component can insert their own markup.

features.name: Imperative slot assignment
features.description: The assign() method for <slot> elements assigns nodes to the slot, as an alternative to using the slot and name HTML attributes. The nodes must be children of a shadow host and the shadow root must be created with the slotAssignment set to "manual". Also known as manual slot assignment.

features.name: <small>
features.description: The <small> element represents side-comments and small print, like copyright and legal text, independent of its styled presentation. Styled in a reduced font size by default.

features.name: SMIL SVG animations
features.description: The <animate>, <animateMotion>, and <animateTransform> SVG elements declaratively animate SVG elements. Also known as SMIL.

features.name: smooth
features.description: The image-rendering: smooth CSS declaration scales images while retaining a gradual color blending that is useful for photos.

features.name: <source>
features.description: The <source> element sets a media resource for the <picture>, <video>, and <audio> elements.

features.name: Sourcemap header
features.description: The Sourcemap HTTP response header links generated code to a source map, so the browser shows the original source in a debugger. This makes it easier to work with minified or transpiled code.

features.name: <span>
features.description: The <span> HTML element is the generic inline container for content.

features.name: speak
features.description: The speak CSS property sets whether or not text should be spoken.

features.name: speak-as
features.description: The speak-as CSS property sets how any element's content is spoken. Not to be confused with the speak-as descriptor of @counter-style at-rules.

features.name: Speculation rules
features.description: Speculation rules are hints to the browser to proactively download pages in the background so they appear instantly when the user navigates to them.

features.name: Speech recognition
features.description: The SpeechRecognition API converts audio into text using the device's speech recognition service.

features.name: Speech recognition grammar
features.description: The SpeechRecognition.grammars property of the Web Speech API represents a set of words or patterns of words that the recognition service should recognize, used for when the recognition service's accuracy is low. This feature has been removed due to advancements in speech recognition.

features.name: Speech synthesis
features.description: The SpeechSynthesis API converts text to speech with artificial voices.

features.name: spellcheck
features.description: The spellcheck global HTML attribute sets whether the browser may check an element for spelling errors.

features.name: Spread syntax
features.description: The spread (...) syntax allows an iterable, such as an array or string, to be expanded in places where zero or more arguments (for function calls) or elements (for array literals) are expected.

features.name: srcset and sizes
features.description: The srcset and sizes attributes for elements set a list of possible sources for the image and a corresponding list of size conditions for choosing a source, to show a responsive image that fits the size of the display.

features.name: Stable array sort
features.description: Stable array sort() function

features.name: Static positioning
features.description: The position: static CSS declaration positions an element in the normal flow. A statically positioned element ignores physical and logical properties such as top or inset-block-start.

features.name: steps() easing
features.description: The steps() CSS easing function divides an animation or transition into equidistant intervals, jumping from value to value. The step-start and step-end keyword values are presets with a single interval.

features.name: Sticky positioning
features.description: The position: sticky CSS declaration positions an element in the normal flow until it crosses a specified threshold, at which points it becomes fixed (stuck) at that position.

features.name: Storage access
features.description: The document.requestStorageAccess() method allows content in iframes to request storing and reading cookies and other site data, while the document.hasStorageAccess() method checks if such access is granted.

features.name: Storage buckets
features.description: The navigator.storageBuckets API allows you to organize locally stored data into groups called storage buckets. Each bucket can have different settings, allowing the browser to manage and delete buckets independently rather than applying the same treatment to all.

features.name: Storage manager
features.description: The navigator.storage API provides information about the availability and persistence of the data that a site stores on the device, by using APIs such as the Cache API or the IndexedDB API.

features.name: Streams
features.description: The streams API creates, composes, and consumes continuously generated data.

features.name: stretch
features.description: The stretch CSS keyword expands a box as needed to fit its contents until the maximum size is reached, without preserving the content's preferred aspect ratio.

features.name: String at()
features.description: The at() method of strings returns the character (one UTF-16 code unit) at an index, including negative indices for getting the character relative to the end of the string. Also known as the relative indexing method.

features.name: String codePointAt() and fromCodePoint()
features.description: The codePointAt() method returns the numeric value of the UTF-16 code point at an index of the string. The fromCodePoint() method returns a string created from one or more code points.

features.name: String includes()
features.description: The includes() method of strings returns whether a search string appears within the string.

features.name: String matchAll()
features.description: The matchAll() method of strings matches a string against a regular expression and returns an iterator of all results, including capturing groups.

features.name: String normalize()
features.description: The normalize() method of strings returns a Unicode normal form of a string as a new string. More than one code point sequence can represent the same characters. You can use the normalize() method to find canonically or compatibly equivalent strings.

features.name: String padStart() and padEnd()
features.description: The padStart() and padEnd() methods of strings return a string lengthened to a minimum number of characters by adding characters to the start or end of the string.

features.name: String raw()
features.description: The String.raw() static method interpolates template literal substitutions, but ignores escape sequences. It is the tag function for template literals.

features.name: String repeat()
features.description: The repeat() method of strings returns the original string repeated a number of times.

features.name: String replaceAll()
features.description: The replaceAll() method of strings returns a new string where all matches of a pattern (a string or regular expression) have been substituted with a replacement string.

features.name: String startsWith() and endsWith()
features.description: The startsWith() and endsWith() methods of strings returns whether a search string appears at the beginning or end of the provided string.

features.name: String trimStart() and trimEnd()
features.description: The trimStart() and trimEnd() methods of strings return a new string with whitespace removed from the beginning or end of the string.

features.name: String isWellFormed() and toWellFormed()
features.description: The isWellFormed() method of strings returns a boolean indicating if the string contains any Unicode lone surrogates. The toWellFormed() method returns a new string where all lone surrogates are replaced by the Unicode replacement character.

features.name: String (initial support)
features.description: The string type (and String object) represents a sequence of characters.

features.name: <strong>
features.description: The <strong> HTML element brings attention to the content, styling text as bold by default.

features.name: structuredClone()
features.description: The structuredClone() global method creates a deep copy of an object. Values that cannot be cloned can instead be transferred, making the original value no longer usable.

features.name: <style>
features.description: The <style> element embeds an inline CSS stylesheet in a document.

features.name: style (attribute)
features.description: The style global HTML attribute applies inline CSS styling declarations to individual elements.

features.name: <sub> and <sup>
features.description: The <sub> and <sup> elements sets inline text to be displayed as subscript or superscript for solely typographical reasons.

features.name: Subgrid
features.description: The subgrid value for the grid-template-columns and grid-template-rows properties allows a grid item to inherit the grid definition of its parent grid container.

features.name: Summarizer
features.description: The Summarizer API uses an on-device language model to summarize text.

features.name: SVG
features.description: The SVG image format, represented by the <svg> element, creates two-dimensional vector graphics with declarative or scripted interaction and animation.

features.name: SVG 1.1 (discouraged)
features.description: The SVG 1.1 image format has several components that were excluded from SVG 2, such as fonts, alternate glyphs, and the xlink namespace.

features.name: SVG filters
features.description: The <filter> SVG element applies custom effects such as color manipulation, blurring, or morphing to SVG elements.

features.name: Symbol
features.description: A Symbol value is a unique, non-enumerable primitive value used for encapsulation or information hiding. For example, a symbol can be a key of an object that can never collide with any other key.

features.name: System colors
features.description: The system color CSS keywords, such as ButtonBorder or LinkText, allow you to match default colors from the user agent.

features.name: tab-size
features.description: The tab-size CSS property sets the width of the tab character.

features.name: tabindex
features.description: The tabindex HTML attribute make an element focusable, and sets the element's relative ordering for sequential focus navigation.

features.name: Tables
features.description: The <table> HTML element, with several related elements, represents tabular data in rows and columns of cells.

features.name: Table styling
features.description: Attributes and properties of table elements, such as align, vAlign, noWrap, bgcolor, or char set various visual presentation properties of the table and its sections and cells. These are obsolete, and some of them have no effect. Use CSS instead. Baseline availability blocked since July 2015 by Firefox (120 months)

features.name: <template>
features.description: The <template> HTML element holds HTML fragments which you can clone and insert into the document using JavaScript.

features.name: Template literals
features.description: Template literals are literals delimited with backtick (`) characters, allowing for multi-line strings, string interpolation with embedded expressions, and special constructs called tagged templates.

features.name: Temporal
features.description: The Temporal API allows you to work with dates, times, time zones, and durations. It is more powerful than the Date API.

features.name: text-align
features.description: The text-align CSS property sets the horizontal placement of the inner content of a block element.

features.name: text-align-last
features.description: The text-align-last CSS property sets the alignment of the last line of text before a forced line break.

features.name: text-autospace
features.description: The text-autospace CSS property sets whether and how to insert spaces in inter-script text (such as when mixing Latin and Chinese characters) and around punctuation.

features.name: text-box
features.description: The text-box CSS property sets the spacing above and below text based on a font's typographic features. For example, text-box: trim-both ex alphabetic trims the top to the top of the letter x and the bottom to the bottom of most letters, without descenders. Baseline availability blocked since February 2025 by Firefox (5 months)

features.name: text-combine-upright
features.description: The text-combine-upright CSS property displays multiple characters in the space of a single character in vertical text. This is used in East Asian documents to display Latin-based strings such as components of a date or letters of an initialism.

features.name: text-decoration
features.description: The text-decoration CSS property sets the style and color of decorative lines including underline, overline, line-through, or a combination of lines.

features.name: text-decoration-line: blink
features.description: The text-decoration: blink CSS declaration flashes text between visible and invisible.

features.name: text-decoration in ::selection
features.description: The text-decoration CSS property in a ::selection rule sets the underline and other text decoration styles on the text a user has highlighted.

features.name: text-emphasis
features.description: The text-emphasis CSS property sets position and style for text emphasis marks, especially for East Asian languages.

features.name: Text encoding and decoding
features.description: The TextEncoder API transforms a stream of code points into a byte stream with UTF-8 encoding, and TextDecoder does the reverse.

features.name: text-indent
features.description: The text-indent CSS property sets the size of the empty space (indentation) at the beginning of lines in a text.

features.name: text-indent: each-line
features.description: The text-indent: each-line CSS declaration indents text after forced breaks as well as to the first line of a block.

features.name: text-indent: hanging
features.description: The text-indent: hanging CSS declaration indents all lines except the first.

features.name: text-justify
features.description: The text-justify CSS property sets the justification method of text when text-align: justify is set.

features.name: text-orientation
features.description: The text-orientation CSS property sets the how text is typeset within a line when the writing mode is vertical.

features.name: Text overflow
features.description: The text-overflow CSS property sets how hidden overflow content appears to users. The property can clip content, truncate content with an ellipsis (â€¦), or truncate with a custom string.

features.name: text-shadow
features.description: The text-shadow CSS property sets the position and styles of shadow on text.

features.name: text-size-adjust
features.description: The text-size-adjust CSS property disables or modifies the browser's default text size adjustment for small screen sizes.

features.name: text-spacing-trim
features.description: The text-spacing-trim CSS property controls spacing around CJK characters, avoiding excessive whitespace when using full-width punctuation characters.

features.name: Text stroke and fill (compatibility prefixes)
features.description: The -webkit-text-stroke-width and -webkit-text-stroke-color CSS properties set the thickness and color of text outlines. The -webkit-text-fill-color sets the color within text character outlines. Both default to the text color.

features.name: Text tracks
features.description: The <track> element is used as a child of the media elements that lets you specify a timed text track to be displayed in parallel with the media element.

features.name: text-transform
features.description: The text-transform CSS property sets text case and capitalization.

features.name: text-underline-offset
features.description: The text-underline-offset CSS property shifts underlines on text from the initial position by a given distance. The initial position is affected by the text-underline-position property.

features.name: text-underline-position
features.description: The text-underline-position CSS property sets the position of underlines on text. For example, text-underline-position: under places the underline below the text, avoiding crossing descenders. The underline may be further adjusted by the text-underline-offset property.

features.name: text-wrap
features.description: The text-wrap CSS property sets how lines break in text that overflows the container. It is a shorthand for text-wrap-style and text-wrap-mode.

features.name: text-wrap: balance
features.description: The text-wrap: balance CSS declaration balances the length of each line when text is broken into multiple lines. Also known as headline balancing.

features.name: text-wrap-mode
features.description: The text-wrap-mode CSS property sets whether lines may wrap with the values wrap and nowrap. It is a longhand property for both white-space and text-wrap.

features.name: text-wrap: nowrap
features.description: The text-wrap: nowrap CSS declaration prevents text breaking into multiple lines. Text that doesn't fit overflows instead.

features.name: text-wrap: pretty
features.description: The text-wrap: pretty CSS declaration prioritizes better layout over speed when text is broken into multiple lines.

features.name: text-wrap: stable
features.description: The text-wrap: stable CSS declaration wraps text using the default algorithm, but does not change wrapping on earlier lines while the text is being edited.

features.name: text-wrap-style
features.description: The text-wrap-style CSS property sets how lines break in text that overflows the container. It can also be set with the text-wrap shorthand.

features.name: <textarea>
features.description: The <textarea> element represents an editing control that allows users to enter multi-line, free-form, plain text.

features.name: <time>
features.description: The <time> HTML element represents a time, such as a calendar date, clock time, or duration. It may include the datetime attribute to translate dates into machine-readable format.

features.name: Time-relative pseudo-selectors
features.description: The :past and :future CSS pseudo-classes match prior or upcoming text track cues during media playback. Baseline availability blocked since January 2020 by Firefox (66 months)

features.name: <title>
features.description: The <title> element sets the title of the document and exposes it to users via the UI of the browser or app they're using and through assistive technology.

features.name: title (attribute)
features.description: The title global HTML attribute sets information about an element, such as a name or description. The value is typically shown as a tooltip that appears on mouse over. Since it's not often available to touch-only, keyboard-only, or assistive technology users, it's not a substitute for other text.

features.name: Top-level await
features.description: The await keyword, when used at the top level of a module (outside of an async function), delays parent module execution until after a promise fulfills.

features.name: touch-action
features.description: The touch-action CSS property sets whether an element on a touch screen can be panned or pinched to zoom.

features.name: Touch events
features.description: Touch events touchstart, touchmove, touchend, and touchcancel fire when users interact with a touch-sensitive surface, such as a screen or drawing tablet. These events are similar to mouse events. Baseline availability blocked since March 2017 by Safari (100 months)

features.name: Transferable ArrayBuffer
features.description: The transfer() and transferToFixedLength() methods of ArrayBuffer move a buffer from one context to another (for example, to a worker).

features.name: Transferable streams
features.description: Streams are transferable objects, which can be moved between contexts such as windows and workers. Baseline availability blocked since July 2022 by Safari (36 months)

features.name: transform-box
features.description: The transform-box CSS property sets the position and dimensions of the reference box relative to which an element's transformations are calculated.

features.name: TransformStream transformer cancel() method
features.description: The cancel() method of a TransformStream transformer cleans up resources when the readable side cancels or the writable side aborts.

features.name: transition-behavior
features.description: The transition-behavior: allow-discrete CSS declaration allows transitions for properties whose animation behavior is discrete. Such properties can't be interpolated and swap from their start value to the end value at 50%.

features.name: Transitions (CSS)
features.description: The transition shorthand CSS property sets how changes to an element's styles may occur over time. Transitions can be applied to specific CSS properties, all properties, or none.

features.name: translate
features.description: The translate HTML attribute marks whether an element's text should be translated.

features.name: sin(), cos(), tan(), asin(), acos(), atan(), and atan2() (CSS)
features.description: The sin(), cos(), tan(), asin(), acos(), atan(), and atan2() CSS functions compute various trigonometric functions.

features.name: Trusted types
features.description: Trusted types allow you to lock down insecure parts of the DOM API and prevent client-side cross-site scripting (XSS) attacks.

features.name: Two-value display property
features.description: The display CSS property accepts multiple keyword values, such as inline flex or block flow, to explicitly set an element's inner and outer layout mode. Also known as 2-value, multi-keyword, or multiple value syntax.

features.name: Typed array iteration methods
features.description: Typed array iteration methods

features.name: Typed array iterators
features.description: Typed arrays are iterable with the for â€¦ of statement and enumerable with the methods entries(), keys(), and values().

features.name: Typed arrays (initial support)
features.description: Typed arrays are ordered lists of JavaScript values, where all values are of the same numerical type, such as 8-bit integers or 32-bit floating point numbers.

features.name: <u>
features.description: The <u> HTML element makes non-textual annotations, styling text as underlined by default.

features.name: User agent client hints
features.description: The Sec-CH-UA HTTP request header and the navigator.userAgentData API expose browser and platform information used to vary responses and application logic. User agent client hints are similar to user agent strings but more privacy-preserving and safer to parse.

features.name: Uint8Array base64 and hex conversion
features.description: The Uint8Array object methods fromBase64(), toBase64(), and setFromBase64() convert to and from base64 strings. The fromHex(), toHex(), and setFromHex() methods convert to and from hex strings.

features.name: Unicode point escapes
features.description: Unicode point escapes (\\u{}) represent Unicode characters within strings.

features.name: unset
features.description: The unset keyword resets any CSS property, removing any values previously set by the author, user, or browser. Inherited properties (like color) reset to the parent element's computed value. Non-inherited properties (like display) reset to the specified initial value (inline).

features.name: Update frequency media query
features.description: The update CSS media query sets styles based on whether and how fast the user's device can modify display after it has been rendered. For example, you can avoid animations on devices that aren't fast enough to display them smoothly.

features.name: Upgrade insecure requests
features.description: The Upgrade-Insecure-Requests HTTP request header tells the server that the response should redirect to a secure (HTTPS) resource.

features.name: URL
features.description: A URL object represents a web address, like https://example.com/, and parts of the address, such as the domain, path, and query string (as URLSearchParams).

features.name: URL.canParse()
features.description: The URL.canParse() static method checks whether a URL can be parsed into a valid URL object. It's an alternative to calling new URL() in a try â€¦ catch statement.

features.name: URLPattern
features.description: The URLPattern API creates patterns that can be matched against URLs or URL components.

features.name: User action pseudo-classes
features.description: The :active, :focus, and :hover CSS pseudo-classes match elements based on how users are interacting with them.

features.name: User activation
features.description: The navigator.userActivation API reveals whether the user has interacted with the page through an "activation" gesture such as a click, tap, or key press. User activation gated APIs (such as the fullscreen API) fail without user interaction, and this API allows you to predict such a failure.

features.name: User agent sniffing
features.description: The navigator.userAgent property is the user agent string for the current browser. Selectively showing content based on the user agent string is unreliable. Consider using feature detection instead.

features.name: user-select
features.description: The user-select CSS property controls which elements can be selected by the user. Baseline availability blocked since July 2020 by Safari (60 months)

features.name: <var>
features.description: The <var> element represents the name of a variable in a mathematical expression or a programming context.

features.name: vertical-align
features.description: The vertical-align CSS property sets the vertical alignment of inline, inline-block, and table cell elements. It has no effect on block-level elements.

features.name: Vertical form controls
features.description: The writing-mode CSS property orients form elements (such as radio buttons, progress bars, or select menus) vertically when the writing mode is vertical-lr or vertical-rl. The direction CSS property sets whether inputs flow from top to bottom or bottom to top.

features.name: Vibration
features.description: The navigator.vibrate() method makes a tactile alert, if the device is equipped with a haptic motor.

safari_desktop.notes: Vendor position : oppose (concerns: integration, use cases, portability, power, annoyance, device independence)

safari_ios.notes: Vendor position : oppose (concerns: integration, use cases, portability, power, annoyance, device independence)

features.name: <video>
features.description: The <video> element plays videos or movies, optionally with controls provided by the browser.

features.name: video-dynamic-range media query
features.description: The video-dynamic-range CSS media query sets styles based on whether a device can display video with at least standard range colors or at least high range colors. Non-visual devices will match neither.

features.name: view-transition-class
features.description: The view-transition-class CSS property sets a name that can be used to apply styles to multiple named view transition pseudo-elements. Baseline availability blocked since December 2024 by Firefox (7 months)

features.name: View transitions
features.description: View transitions allow you to create animated visual transitions between different states of a document. Baseline availability blocked since September 2024 by Firefox (10 months)

features.name: Small, large, and dynamic viewport units
features.description: The sv*, lv*, and dv* CSS viewport units are relative to the smallest, largest, and current (dynamic) viewport size. They are used to size elements in relation to the viewport's dimensions.

features.name: Viewport units
features.description: The vw, vh, vmin, and vmax CSS viewport units are relative to the size of the viewport, and are used to size elements in relation to the viewport's dimensions.

features.name: Virtual keyboard
features.description: The navigator.virtualKeyboard API inspects and controls on-screen virtual keyboards. You can use it to programmatically hide or show a virtual keyboard or respond to the keyboard disappearing or appearing.

features.name: Virtual pressure sources
features.description: The CreateVirtualPressureSource WebDriver command creates artificial sources of compute pressure for testing without the need real device sources of compute pressure.

safari_desktop.notes: Vendor position : oppose (concerns: privacy, device independence)

safari_ios.notes: Vendor position : oppose (concerns: privacy, device independence)

features.name: Virtual sensors
features.description: The CreateVirtualSensor WebDriver command creates a virtual sensor for testing applications that use sensor APIs, without the need for real device sensors.

features.name: visibility
features.description: The visibility CSS property sets whether an element is shown. Invisible elements still affect the document layout.

features.name: Visual viewport API
features.description: The visualViewport API provides a way to query and modify the user-visible viewport of a web page.

features.name: WebAssembly
features.description: The WebAssembly.instantiate() and WebAssembly.instantiateStreaming() global static methods load WebAssembly code (also known as Wasm), a portable binary instruction format.

features.name: BigInt to i64 conversion (WebAssembly)
features.description: Integer values pass bidirectionally between JavaScript and WebAssembly, converted to i64 values in WebAssembly or BigInt values in JavaScript.

features.name: Bulk memory operations (WebAssembly)
features.description: Bulk memory operations, such as copy and init, mirror the efficiency of native memcpy and memmove operations.

features.name: Exception handling (WebAssembly)
features.description: Exceptions break the normal control flow of execution to represent exceptional behavior, such as an error. You can respond to the exception in JavaScript code.

features.name: Exception references with exnref (WebAssembly)
features.description: When caught, an exception is reified into an exception reference, a value of the new type exnref.

features.name: Extended constant expressions (WebAssembly)
features.description: The i32.add, i32.sub, i32.mul, i64.add, i64.sub, and i64.mul operations extend constant expressions to include arithmetic.

features.name: Garbage collection (WebAssembly)
features.description: Garbage collection tracks references for better memory management with garbage-collected languages running in WebAssmbly.

features.name: Memory64 (WebAssembly)
features.description: Instructions accept 64-bit memory indexes. Baseline availability blocked since February 2025 by Safari (5 months)

features.name: Multi-memory (WebAssembly)
features.description: A single module in WebAssembly can have multiple memories. Baseline availability blocked since April 2024 by Safari (15 months)

features.name: Multi-value (WebAssembly)
features.description: Instructions and blocks can produce multiple result values.

features.name: Import and export of mutable globals (WebAssembly)
features.description: Mutable global variables are importable and exportable.

features.name: Non-trapping float-to-int conversion (WebAssembly)
features.description: Saturating floating-point to integer conversion operators return the maximum or minimum integer value on overflow instead of trapping.

features.name: Reference types (WebAssembly)
features.description: The externref type can be both a value type and a table element type, while funcref can be a value type.

features.name: Sign extension operators (WebAssembly)
features.description: Sign-extension operator instructions extend the width of 8-bit, 16-bit, and 32-bit values to 32-bit and 64-bit values.

features.name: Fixed-width SIMD (WebAssembly)
features.description: 128-bit SIMD (Single Instruction Multiple Data) performs one instruction on multiple units of data, when running on hardware that supports such instructions. Also known as vector instructions.

features.name: Relaxed-width SIMD (WebAssembly)
features.description: Relaxed SIMD (Single Instruction Multiple Data) introduces local non-determinism, where the results of the instructions may vary based on hardware support.

features.name: String builtins (WebAssembly)
features.description: The WebAssembly builtin string functions mirror a subset of the JavaScript String API and adapt it to be efficiently callable without JavaScript glue code. Baseline availability blocked since January 2025 by Safari (6 months)

features.name: Tail call optimization (WebAssembly)
features.description: Tail call optimization discards a caller frame and replaces the call with a jump instruction.

features.name: Threads and atomics (WebAssembly)
features.description: Threads in WebAssembly run code in parallel, while atomic memory instructions can guarantee that no two threads can read or write to shared memory at the same time.

features.name: Typed function references (WebAssembly)
features.description: A typed function reference can be called directly.

features.name: <wbr>
features.description: The <wbr> HTML element represents a word break opportunity, to explicitly mark a place within a word where a line might be broken.

features.name: Weak references
features.description: The WeakRef and FinalizationRegistry objects hold references to garbage-collectable objects without creating strong references that prevent their garbage collection.

features.name: WeakMap
features.description: A WeakMap object holds key-value pairs that do not create strong references to its keys, such that value data can be associated with a key without preventing garbage collection of the key.

features.name: WeakSet
features.description: A WeakSet object stores unique values of any type without creating strong references to the values, such that membership in the set does not prevent garbage collection of the value.

features.name: Web animations
features.description: The web animation API programmatically creates, inspects, and controls element animations, to change and synchronize appearance over time.

features.name: Web Audio
features.description: The Web Audio API creates graphs of audio nodes that handle sound inputs, synthesize sounds, apply effects, create visualizations, and output to audio devices.

features.name: Web Bluetooth
features.description: The Web Bluetooth API enables selecting and communicating with nearby Bluetooth devices.

features.name: Web Cryptography
features.description: The Web Cryptography API performs low-level cryptographic operations, such as encryption, decryption, and signature verification. Also known as the Web Crypto API.

features.name: Locks
features.description: The navigator.locks API coordinates work with shared resources through mutually exclusive ownership of a resource's name. Also known as web locks.

features.name: Web MIDI
features.description: The Web MIDI API enables selecting MIDI input and output devices and sending and receiving MIDI messages.

features.name: Web NFC
features.description: The NDEFReader API reads and writes messages to near-field communication (NFC) tags.

features.name: WebOTP
features.description: The OTPCredential API represents a one-time-password (OTP).

features.name: Web authentication
features.description: The web authentication API allows you to create public key-based credentials and use them for authentication, such as when signing in. Also known as WebAuthn.

features.name: Web authentication easy public key access
features.description: The getAuthenticatorData(), getPublicKey(), and getPublicKeyAlgorithm() methods of AuthenticatorAttestationResponse access credential data inside attestationObject without the need to parse it.

features.name: WebCodecs
features.description: The WebCodecs API provides low-level access to individual video frames and chunks of audio samples, for full control over the way media is processed.

features.name: WebDriver
features.description: The WebDriver interface allows out-of-process programs to inspect and control browsers to, for example, run tests of web applications. Also known as WebDriver classic.

features.name: WebDriver BiDi
features.description: WebDriver BiDi is a bidirectional protocol that allows a WebDriver client and a browser to communicate with each other. Baseline availability blocked since October 2022 by Safari (33 months)

features.name: WebGL
features.description: The WebGLRenderingContext API is the "webgl" rendering context for the <canvas> element. It represents a space for drawing two- and three-dimensional graphics and animations.

features.name: WEBGL_color_buffer_float WebGL extension
features.description: The WEBGL_color_buffer_float extension for WebGL 1.0 contexts adds the 32-bit floating-point type RGBA32F as a color-renderable format.

features.name: Color management for WebGL
features.description: The drawingBufferColorSpace and unpackColorSpace properties of WebGLRenderingContext sets the color representation for the buffer and imported textures, such as "srgb" or "display-p3".

features.name: WEBGL_compressed_texture_astc WebGL extension
features.description: The WEBGL_compressed_texture_astc extension for WebGL 1.0 and 2.0 contexts adds the Adaptive Scalable Texture Compression format to compressedTexImage2D() and compressedTexSubImage2D().

features.name: WEBGL_compressed_texture_etc WebGL extension
features.description: The WEBGL_compressed_texture_etc extension for WebGL 1.0 and 2.0 contexts adds many ETC2 and EAC compressed texture formats to compressedTexImage2D() and compressedTexSubImage2D(). Baseline availability blocked since March 2020 by Firefox (64 months)

features.name: WEBGL_compressed_texture_etc1 WebGL extension
features.description: The WEBGL_compressed_texture_etc1 extension for WebGL 1.0 and 2.0 contexts adds the ETC1 compressed texture format to compressedTexImage2D() and compressedTexSubImage2D(). Baseline availability blocked since March 2020 by Firefox (64 months)

features.name: WEBGL_compressed_texture_pvrtc WebGL extension
features.description: The WEBGL_compressed_texture_pvrtc extension for WebGL 1.0 and 2.0 contexts adds PVRTC compressed texture formats to compressedTexImage2D() and compressedTexSubImage2D(). Baseline availability blocked since August 2024 by Firefox (11 months)

features.name: WEBGL_compressed_texture_s3tc WebGL extension
features.description: The WEBGL_compressed_texture_s3tc extension for WebGL 1.0 and 2.0 contexts adds S3TC compressed texture formats to compressedTexImage2D() and compressedTexSubImage2D().

features.name: WEBGL_compressed_texture_s3tc_srgb WebGL extension
features.description: The WEBGL_compressed_texture_s3tc_srgb extension for WebGL 1.0 and 2.0 contexts adds S3TC compressed texture formats for the sRGB colorspace to compressedTexImage2D() and compressedTexSubImage2D(). Baseline availability blocked since April 2021 by Firefox for Android (51 months)

features.name: WEBGL_debug_renderer_info WebGL extension
features.description: The WEBGL_debug_renderer_info extension for WebGL 1.0 and 2.0 contexts exposes information about the graphics driver for debugging purposes.

features.name: WEBGL_debug_shaders WebGL extension
features.description: The WEBGL_debug_shaders extension for WebGL 1.0 and 2.0 contexts adds the getTranslatedShaderSource() method to debug shaders from privileged contexts.

features.name: WEBGL_depth_texture WebGL extension
features.description: The WEBGL_depth_texture extension for WebGL 1.0 contexts defines 2D depth and depth-stencil textures.

features.name: Desynchronized WebGL canvas
features.description: The optional desynchronized parameter of a canvas's getContext() method permits the browser to draw a WebGL canvas independently of the event loop. This can reduce drawing latency.

features.name: WEBGL_draw_buffers WebGL extension
features.description: The WEBGL_draw_buffers extension for WebGL 1.0 contexts enables a fragment shader to write to several textures, which is useful for deferred shading, for example.

features.name: WEBGL_lose_context WebGL extension
features.description: The WEBGL_lose_context extension for WebGL 1.0 and 2.0 contexts simulates losing and restoring a WebGLRenderingContext or WebGL2RenderingContext.

features.name: WEBGL_multi_draw WebGL extension
features.description: The WEBGL_multi_draw extension for WebGL 1.0 and 2.0 contexts renders more than one primitive with a single function call. Baseline availability blocked since September 2021 by Firefox (46 months)

features.name: OES_draw_buffers_indexed WebGL extension
features.description: The OES_draw_buffers_indexed extension for WebGL 2.0 contexts allows you to control blending on a per-color basis when writing to multiple color buffers simultaneously.

features.name: SharedArrayBuffer in WebGL
features.description: SharedArrayBuffer objects can be used in WebGL APIs that previously only worked with ArrayBuffer objects. Baseline availability blocked since July 2020 by Safari (60 months)

features.name: WebGL2
features.description: The WebGL2RenderingContext API is the "webgl2" rendering context for the <canvas> element. It represents a space for drawing two- and three-dimensional graphics and animations. It corresponds to OpenGL ES 3.0.

features.name: Color management for WebGL2
features.description: The drawingBufferColorSpace and unpackColorSpace properties of WebGL2RenderingContext sets the color representation for the buffer and imported textures, such as "srgb" or "display-p3".

features.name: Desynchronized WebGL2 canvas
features.description: The optional desynchronized parameter of a canvas's getContext() method permits the browser to draw a WebGL2 canvas independently of the event loop. This can reduce drawing latency.

features.name: WebGPU
features.description: The navigator.gpu API performs operations such as rendering and computation on dedicated graphics hardware (also known as a Graphics Processing Unit).

features.name: WebHID
features.description: The WebHID API provides access to Human Interface Devices (HID) that are connected to the user's device.

features.name: WebNN
features.description: The WebNN API constructs and executes computational graphs of neural networks by making use of the various machine learning capabilities and hardware accelerators available on the device. Also known as Web Neural Network API.

features.name: WebP
features.description: The WebP image format is a raster graphics file format that supports animation, alpha transparency, and lossy as well as lossless compression.

features.name: WebRTC
features.description: The WebRTC API establishes real-time communication channels directly between browsers. It is commonly used in video conferencing applications.

features.name: WebRTC encoded transform
features.description: The WebRTC encoded transform API allows you to modify audio and video streams in WebRTC connections. For example, it can be used for visual effects or custom codecs.

features.name: WebRTC SCTP information
features.description: The sctp object on RTCPeerConnection represents the negotiated SCTP transport. SCTP (Stream Control Transmission Protocol) is the protocol that RTCDataChannel uses.

features.name: WebRTC statistics
features.description: The RTCPeerConnection.getStats(), RTCRtpSender.getStats(), and RTCRtpReceiver.getStats() methods return detailed information about the status, performance, network, and media for a given WebRTC connection.

features.name: WebSockets
features.description: The WebSocket API opens a two-way communication channel between the user's browser and a server.

features.name: WebTransport
features.description: The WebTransport API transmits data between a client and a server, by using the HTTP/3 protocol. Baseline availability blocked since June 2023 by Safari (25 months)

features.name: WebUSB
features.description: The WebUSB API exposes USB compatible devices to web pages.

safari_desktop.notes: Vendor position (concerns: privacy, security, device independence)

safari_ios.notes: Vendor position (concerns: privacy, security, device independence)

features.name: WebVR
features.description: The navigator.getVRDisplays() API represents virtual reality (VR) devices, including sensors and head-mounted displays.

features.name: WebVTT
features.description: WebVTT is a captions and subtitles format. WebVTT files are loaded using the <track> element, and the VTTCue API can be used to create or update cues dynamically.

features.name: WebVTT cue alignment
features.description: The WebVTT cue alignment settings control which part of the cue is aligned with the given line and position. Cue alignment is set using line and position settings in WebVTT files or the lineAlign and positionAlign properties of VTTCue using JavaScript.

features.name: WebVTT cue settings
features.description: The VTTCue API updates various aspects of cues dynamically, such as alignment, size and position.

features.name: WebVTT regions
features.description: WebVTT regions set the areas of the video where captions or subtitles should be rendered, such as placing roll-up captions used for live captions.

features.name: Anchors (WebXR)
features.description: An XRAnchor object keeps track of a pose that is fixed relative to the real world. Anchors build an illusion that the placed objects are really present in the user's environment.

features.name: Augmented reality
features.description: The "immersive-ar" value for navigator.xr.requestSession() starts an augmented reality WebXR session that renders content aligned with the visible environment.

features.name: Raw camera access for WebXR
features.description: The XRView.camera property provides direct access to pose-synchronized camera images within a WebXR session.

features.name: Depth sensing
features.description: An XRDepthInformation object represents a measurement of the distance from the user's device to the real-world geometry in the user's environment.

features.name: WebXR
features.description: The navigator.xr API represents the browser's virtual reality or augmented reality system. You can use to request a WebXR session.

features.name: DOM overlays for WebXR
features.description: A DOM overlay shows 2D DOM content as an interactive, transparent layer on top of a WebXR application's WebGL content and camera image.

features.name: Gamepad (WebXR)
features.description: The gamepad attribute of an XRInputSource represents an XR input device, such as a motion controller, that reports data from physical inputs (such as buttons, touch pads, and triggers).

features.name: Hand input
features.description: An XRHand object, from the hand attribute of an XRInputSource object, represents a WebXR session's fully-articulated hand tracking model.

features.name: Hit test
features.description: The getHitTestResults() method of an XRFrame object helps place objects in an augmented reality session by finding where cast rays intersect with real-world geometry.

features.name: Layers (WebXR)
features.description: WebXR layer types, such as XRCylinderLayer, XRCylinderLayer, XREquirectLayer, XRProjectionLayer or XRQuadLayer, are managed by the system compositor, to reduce latency or resampling.

features.name: Lighting estimation
features.description: The XRLightProbe and XRLightEstimate objects represent real-world environmental lighting conditions during a WebXR session.

features.name: Wheel events
features.description: The wheel event fires when the user moves a mouse wheel or similar spatially rotating input device. Baseline availability blocked since July 2015 by Safari on iOS (120 months)

features.name: white-space
features.description: The white-space CSS property sets how white space is collapsed and how lines wrap. It is a shorthand for white-space-collapse and text-wrap-mode.

features.name: white-space-collapse
features.description: The white-space-collapse CSS property sets whether new line characters are shown as line breaks, and whether multiple consecutive spaces are all displayed or combined.

features.name: Widows and orphans
features.description: The widows and orphans CSS properties set the minimum lines included in a text fragment created by page, column, or region breaks. Baseline availability blocked since July 2015 by Firefox (120 months)

features.name: Width and height
features.description: The width and height CSS properties set the preferred physical size of an element.

features.name: will-change
features.description: The will-change CSS property gives hints to the browser about expected changes to an element's scroll position, contents, or style. These hints allow browsers to optimize for upcoming style changes.

features.name: Window
features.description: The window global object represents a browser tab or iframe and its relationship to the document and other tabs. It's also a generic global object, under which many other APIs are located.

features.name: Window Controls Overlay
features.description: The display_override:\ ["window-controls-overlay"] web application manifest member shows content in the title bar area of a progressive web app that is installed on a desktop device.

features.name: Window management
features.description: The window.getScreenDetails() method gets information about the screens on a device, which you can use to place new windows on a specific screen with window.open().

features.name: with
features.description: The with JavaScript statement adds a given object to the chain of scopes used to evaluate names.

features.name: word-break
features.description: The word-break CSS property sets how lines break within words.

features.name: word-break: auto-phrase
features.description: The word-break: auto-phrase CSS declaration specifies that wrapping should occur at natural phrase boundaries, especially in CJK languages.

features.name: word-break: break-word
features.description: The word-break: break-word CSS declaration sets word breaks to occur according to their customary rules. Superseded by overflow-wrap: anywhere.

features.name: word-spacing
features.description: The word-spacing CSS property sets the amount of white space between words.

features.name: writing-mode
features.description: The writing-mode CSS property sets whether text is laid out horizontally or vertically, and left to right, or right to left.

features.name: writing-mode SVG 1.1 values
features.description: The lr, lr-tb, rl, rl-tb, tb, and tb-rl keyword values for the writing-mode CSS property set the text direction for elements in SVG 1.1 documents.

features.name: writingsuggestions
features.description: The writingsuggestions HTML attribute turns on or off a browser's writing suggestions. Writing suggestions vary by browser. For example, if turned on then a browser might show inline text completions accepted by pressing Tab. Baseline availability blocked since September 2024 by Firefox (10 months)

features.name: XMLHttpRequest
features.description: The XMLHttpRequest API makes HTTP requests. It's the predecessor to fetch(). Also known as XHR.

features.name: XMLSerializer
features.description: The XMLSerializer API provides the serializeToString() method to construct an XML string representing a DOM tree.

features.name: XPath
features.description: The document.evaluate() method selects elements in an HTML or XML document based on an expression of XPath, a domain specific language for querying XML documents. Also known as XML Path Language.

features.name: XSLT
features.description: The XSLTProcessor API transforms XML documents into new XML or HTML documents, using XSLT stylesheets. You can use XSLT to convert data between different XML schemas or to convert XML data into web pages or PDF documents. Also known as Extensible Stylesheet Language Transformations.

features.name: z-index
features.description: The z-index CSS property orders overlapping elements, with higher values appearing in front of or on top of lower values.

features.name: zoom
features.description: The zoom CSS property scales the size of an element. Unlike the transform property, a zoomed element affects page layout.

features.name: Zstandard compression
features.description: Zstandard or zstd is fast lossless compression algorithm. When used as a content encoding, it is often faster and offers better compression than brotli. Baseline availability blocked since May 2024 by Safari (14 months)
